description:
Best alcoholic drinks plus cute atmosphere! How much better can it get?

As I walked up the stairs, I was fascinated on how beautiful it was. There were little lights and decorations everywhere. I proceeded to go to the bar to get a drink. My fave alcohol is tequila so I got the La Ponderosa. The drink was good, but then my friend let me try her drink (Fashion Victim) and it was EVEN BETTER. It tasted like juice! Mixed drinks aren't my thing but these Alchemist cocktails are so delicious.

This bar is definitely chill vibes and more of a socializing bar. Although there was music, people didn't dance. Nonetheless, Alchemist is still a great place to have a chill night and enjoy a yummy cocktail.
author: Julian Y.

description:
Really dope vibes at this place. Kinda hipster and vintage at the same time. My friend and I went to grab a bite and a drink. She got something with vodka (that's the drinks name) and I got la ponderosa. 

She got the spinach artichoke dip and I got the chicken and waffles. The chicken is basically nuggets which is even easier to eat than a tender. The service was quick and everyone was friendly and helpful. 

Cool spot if you're trying to avoid the touristy places.
author: Nancy M.

description:
Some close friends brought me here after dinner in Soma for some cocktails. It's a funky place with fun decor, couches, a great cocktail menu and some very friendly and accommodating bartenders. 

We came on a night that was very empty so I asked the bartender for a recommendation for a drink based on my preferences and what I was in the mood for. He made something on a whim that was super tasty and exactly what I was looking for. Thanks, Ramón! You're the best! 

Couches were comfy and they had decent music and were playing weird Tim Burtonesque cartoons on the wall from a projector. Loved the wall of books. I can imagine this place being a madhouse when full but it was chill while I was there.
author: Ashtar B.

description:
Great hot spot off the beat and path.  We'll it's on 3rd st but it an upstairs bar, could be a hidden jem, but I know it's fun. The bartender are great, they mix a great and refreshing drink.  
Fun after work spot!!!
author: David E.

description: Cute bar, great drinks, however, the service is not that great. We went here to get drinks on a weekday night. It was not that crowded and had a nice ambience.
author: Lovereen K.

description:
Open and airy.  I likes. Friday night and it's a nice crowd but definitely not overwhelming.  If you get a table,  there's table service ( waitress) for you. Thats a plus.  I didn't have to stand at the bar.  They have specialty cocktails to choose from.  They're are at least 3 that i wanted to try containing bourbon or scotch.  I got the bourbon and mezcal beverage. Delicious. Perfect smoke taste.  Accidentally we were given the drink that has tequila in it. Before tasting, we were told that's it was the wrong drink. But we were able to keep it to try it out. I like to try various Cocktails so of course trying it was a plus for me. However I didn't like it so if you like tequila in might be up to your par but not mine. I was at a bit hungry so I went with the deviled eggs that came out in for small parts. I think out of the four parts it probably equals up to one egg. But no biggie. The bites on the menu seemed like some great options.. enough options to come back and try.
You know what I enjoyed a lot? The music. The genres of music that they were playing where are so awesome. They even actually played Don't Worry Be Happy. And I don't know about you but that song makes me not worry and be happy. I also noticed that it was an area that kind of set up like in a plateau like Style that seem like you can maybe rent that part out to have a small intimate party but not a party. I liked it here
author: Elease T.

description:
This bar fulfills the steampunk fantasy I didn't even know I had in a bar atmosphere. Walking up the stairs you see that the entire bar is immaculately decorated. The bar itself is built with a lot of industrial lighting and piping. There are projectors playing shadow-like videos above the bar as well as on the walls which adds to the total ambiance.

I am so bummed I didn't write down the drink I got because it was a tequila raspberry deliciousness. The menu had a wide array of drinks and quite a bit of food too.

The nice thing of this place is that it is really spacious especially in comparisons to others. Quite a bit of seating and a lot of standing room. There was a company mixer going on but my friend & I didn't feel squeezed for space at all.
author: Stephen P.

description:
I'm going to say this bar & lounge is unique! It's like being in this abandoned warehouse or huge brick-walled loft. There's an empty space in the main living area for either people standing around or a dance floor, some comfy couches to lounge in and a fully-stocked bar in the corner with a dope bartender! Their cocktail menu here is something I haven't seen before with unique blends. 

I ordered a guava cocktail which had an actual guava fruit and bitters. It was called, "Rum is the new bassline": rum blend, black tea, milk, cinnamon, basil, lime and guava soda. It's exotic and tastes refreshing. It's definitely a cocktail meant for summer evenings. It's crisp and delicious; worth $13! 

Overall, this cocktail bar deserves another go around, on a Friday & Saturday night where there's a bigger crowd and a more vibrant feel. We came last night which was empty on a Monday evening. 

I'm coming back for more!
author: Allister D.

description:
To date this is one of my absolute favorite bars in the city.    It is all around perfect.  Great drinks, check.  Good food, check.  Amazing music, check.  Ambiance, check. 

It's not too crowded and even have a long happy hour from 5-8.   This the best spot to go to before a giants game since the happy hour is until 8.  

There's no DJ but man the music is so insanely good! It's not a club but just right for socializing and grooving if you're feeling the beat.  Great spot if your style is a bar that's upscale enough with classy people, classy drinks, not too crowded, and you can dance if you want to.
author: Michelle T.

description: Went this last Friday. Not going to lie the bar tenders are less then friendly. They seem like they don't want to be there. I waited 10 minutes sitting right in front of two bar tenders to be greeted. Wasn't overly busy.
author: Erin G.

description:
Good drinks, fun atmosphere! 

My boyfriend and I came here before a giants game. It was only a couple of blocks away. It was nice too because they were playing the basketball playoff games on their projector. 

They have a happy hour too! We didn't really see the happy hour menu until it was too late and we ordered our tasty drinks. We loved it!
author: Heather I.

description: Very mysterious and interesting type of bar. Very fun, have you read the book? I went here one night and yeah, it's pretty dark and that haubted house type of disney vibe is here.
author: Jray M.

description:
Drinks: 3
Atmosphere: 5

Alchemist is a mix of speakeasy, lounge, hip and trendy with movies projected on the walls and dim, yellow-ish lighting. The atmosphere is great and great attention to detail has been payed when designing the spot. 

The drinks we had, however, were just mediocre. And their Sangria was pretty bad. 

And if you plan on driving, keep in mind that the meters in the area go until 10PM (except for special days) and it's $7 an hour!
author: Mario B.

description:
Entrance could be easy to miss but you'll see the bouncer outside the door and once you enter the building, you go up a staircase to the bar
Super chill vibe inside with cool projectors playing black+white cartoon clips. The space is pretty large with bar seating, high top tables and couches. It was surprising that it was pretty quiet in here on a Saturday night but I'm fine with that - faster service and couches open. 
Drinks were good but inconsistent
author: Vicky R.

description:
The definition of hipster.

To get to Alchemist, you go up a narrow flight of stairs decorated with old steampuck style knick knacks. Once you're upstairs, there are old movies playing on the walls. It's not huge, with scattered seating and tables along the walls; there's quite a bit of empty space between the walls and the bar, so presumably if it's crowded expect standing room only.

The bar's selection is impressive, including three (!) different types of the famed Yamazaki whisky (12 year, Hakushu 12 year, and Hibiki Harmony). Their thyme cocktail was also absolutely delicious and unique. I hear they switch up their cocktails with regularity, so definitely motivation for repeat visits!

It's arguably "just" another bar in the city, but with the cool vibe and rotating drink menu I would be happy to make this part of my bar crawling rotation!
author: Christine Y.

description: Cool upstairs bar that is walking distance to/from AT&T Park. The tonic they use in there drinks is really good so if you are a vodka tonic fan I recommend trying it. Seems to be a pretty popular spot. Took a little bit to get a drink due to the crowed but like I said the drinks were good and you can tell most people behind the bar are legit bartenders. The look and feel of this place is unique and trendy. Great spot to grab a drink or 3 after a game!
author: Chase M.

description: A deceivingly spacious second-floor bar with a little semiprivate area, perfect for casual group gatherings. Came here for a birthday and then an engagement party. Found it pretty hard to order drinks when it was even half busy, and the drinks tended to be on the sweet side.
author: Vivian H.

description:
A Gem! Amazing vibe in this bar, not as crowded as you would expect for a Friday night in SF or what you would see while in any bars down in Mission!

It has sections all around the place which is great if you have a group of friends and you don't want to hang out on the bar standing and chatting while hovering over other people with drinks.

We got attended to at the Bar by Mike! He has been bartending for a while apparently and comes down to SF all the way from So Cal... San Diego.. so may be that added to be being more biased towards the cocktails...

Every cocktail he created was perfectly done. He expressed how he wants to spend 2-3 minute creating these cocktails... that's a great Bartender there!

I told him we are coming back soon :)
author: Pranamee S.

description:
Excellent and unique cocktails, the most friendly staff in any bar in the Bay Area.
Comfortable and fun. The only reason for -1 Star is the lo dress of the music (too loud for a place where conversations happen). The smoky fries are great!
author: Millennium S.

description: This place has an awesome atmosphere, but not crowded at all on a Saturday night around at all. The drink menu was definitely interesting. It might be the kind of place where you need to bring your own fun? There was lots of seating (couches tables etc). We ordered two drinks that were okay (I believe their menu rotates) and some bar bites. The reason why I am giving them a 3 Star is because my tots were cold. They were obviously frozen and it's really not hard to cook them through. We told our bartender and he told us that it happened to him sometimes as well??? He was a nice guy but obviously not having the best day. It took us a while to even get our tab and there were not that many people there.
author: Sara S.

description:
Great place for a Wednesday happy hour with hubs. There was plenty of seating (the place was maybe half full), steampunky décor, delicious craft cocktails and food. 

Service was great, with the waitress checking frequently though not annoyingly so on the status of our drinks.  With two rounds of cocktails, an order of the spicy fries and fish tacos, the total was only $48 (before tip). 

This was our first time going but it seemed like the crowd was mixed between casual after-work crowds combined with the ritzy dress-to-impress, ages 20s-40s. Basically come as you may and enjoy this place for the speakeasy feel and delicious fare. 

Would definitely return :)
author: Sarah L.

description:
The Alchemist feels like a mix of speakeasy and lounge. Indeed, you're greeted with antique décor as you enter the stairs at ground level, and walking up to the second floor venue adds to the "hidden" or "clandestine" mystique. Once you're upstairs, though, there's actually lots of room to spread out, as it's a surprisingly open space. 

The menu might be a bit limited for some, but I find that focusing on about 10 or so core cocktails eliminates the need for endless decision-making and also makes things simple for the staff. I enjoyed my drinks, whether the "sweet caroline" (cachaça, giffard orgeat, pineapple gum syrup, allspice dram, lime juice) or the "shrub down" (denizen rum, strawberry and rhubarb shrub, crème de banana, lemon).

A perfect venue for hanging out any day of the week, whether or not there's a ball game nearby.
author: Vincent L.

description: The drinks were really dilute, the House was very noisy.... it doesn't have a medicinal (:D) feel. Good thing was this place has really nice and quick service. The hostess was really sweet.
author: Akhil G.

description:
Not sure why everyone is raving about how this is a "hipster, gem." The alchemist is what the Edison in downtown LA turns into at around 10:30 PM: a beautiful turn-of-the-century-inspired space with loft windows, dark wood, and clever shadow films on the walls, garbage acoustics that make your ears bleed, and all filled with a douchiest crowd there ever was found outside of investment banker land. The acoustics do you the favor of ensuring the wall of pretentious, try-hard, vapid noise keeps you from hearing your companion(s) speak or enjoying the beautiful space in silence when you give up on conversation.

The place is missing any charm or joi de vivre and entirely takes its self too seriously to leave you anything but slightly jaded. 

To be fair, this likely isn't the owner/management team's fault but due to the venture capitalists the space attracts. Or maybe it's the vibe they're going for after all and I'm just a bit disappointed because I came around looking for a Villain's Tavern (if you're ever in the LA arts district, check it out) and I got a midnight at the Edison. So by all means go visit - it is aesthetically lovely; like a must-see movie with the latest in CGI but absolutely no soul left of what you can infer was the original vision.
author: Cristina M.

description:
Frequent this place often and love the service we get every time!
Friendly bartenders and great drinks too!
author: Jennifer W.

description:
Easy to miss! There is a teeny tiny entrance to Alchemist on 3rd with a discreet sign. The entrance leads you up a flight of stairs to the bar. Along the stairway there is a collection of antique books, laboratory equipment and just general quirky 19th century doodads. A good sign in my "book" (hehehe). 

Overall, Alchemist feels like a speakeasy. The decorations, the projected shadow puppet shows on the walls and the overall vibes=speakeasy. Happy hour has a great selection of cheap drinks! For one, there is a combo beer+shot for about $8! I had a Marlow + tequila shot. Not too shabby! 

In terms of attire, I'd say business casual is best suited for Alchemist. Although many were wearing Giants gear, the best compliment to this atmosphere would be [for ladies: nice top paired with pants and wedges] [for men: button up shirt]. 

I'll have to come back to get more feedback regarding food, other drinks etc...

Bottom Line: Easy going speakeasy vibes with shadow puppets.
author: Jaime W.

description: Cool ambience. Love the decoration, interior and wall projections. Everything about this place is hip and cool. I got a egg nog drink which was interesting. Did some tequila shots but nothing unusual there. Also got sliders from their limited food menu. It was ok. Parking is street parking n was not so bad. Would highly recommend this place if u r looking for a fun n funky date night.
author: Nidhi D.

description: Went here for the first time on Friday night. Found this via Yelp and it had good reviews and it did not disappoint :-) not your typical bar at all unusual decor definitely the steampunk Vibe for sure great music lots of old school if you love the 80s as I do :-) :-) cocktails were phenomenal I had the Emerald Tablet and I also tried my friends drink that was called millionaire number one. Both of them were amazing. The Emerald Tablet had gin limoncello pistachio syrup lime absinthe and Eucalyptus. Millionaire number one had Jamaican rum Sloe Gin apricot liqueur grenadine and lime. Didn't realize they had food in till much later on in the evening and I had the carnitas tacos which were completely phenomenal! Sweet and spicy the meat was absolutely superb. The staff was friendly and not to mention pretty damn good looking! Looking forward to coming back here again :-)
author: Gina G.

description: I absolutely loved this place, we just randomly picked this place as we did not want to walk and I guess we made a right choice place has good vibes and interiors is pretty nice, this place is one of the place I would definitely go with my friends and chill and booze.
author: Pari B.

description: Mike was the best bartender! He really paid attention to us and did a great job! Try the something with vodka it's amazing!! love this bar!
author: Sierra W.

description: 5 star. Fun cocktails, great for groups.. not the place for intimate conversation, too noisy
author: Trinity L.

description: Walked in here on a cold night last week.  Steps are a trip (not literally but looked cool, see pictures) and had good ambience right when we stepped in.  Fortunately a huge couch to the right opened up and we sat next to the silhouette old school movies on the wall.  Not too crowded but easy to get drinks.  The hostess was really nice and had a great suggestion with a "raising with wolves" cocktail.  Also my wife had a baracus cocktail.  Friends had a good time and drinks were strong.  Definitely a recommended spot for anyone in soma.  We also had some delicious truffle fries (although I'm not a huge fan of truffle - it's usually made with 2,4-dithiapentane - but everyone liked it)   the sliders were great.
author: Jeffrey T.

description: The place deserves its 4 stars: not too crowded, awesome happy hour prices ($5 per bubbly glass until 8pm) and extremely friendly service. The waitress always came at the right moment, refilling our glasses when we felt like drinking more and bringing the check when we were ready to go. Will go again to try out cocktails!
author: Clémentine C.

description: We booked the upstairs lounge for a private party and it was a hit. Cocktails were sophisticated and well prepared. Wait staff was friendly and quick, and the steampunk decor felt both edgy and refined. I plan to come here more often.
author: Ty V.

description: Visited for the first time last night and couldn't have been more pleased. First, the music was FANTASTIC, modern and upbeat, setting the right mood for a Friday happy hour. The drinks were delicious. I had the Something With Vodka, and it was perfect. Can't wait to return!
author: Andrea M.

description: My girlfriend and I dropped in here prior to dinner and Alexander's last night. I had heard about it but had never been. This place is awesome. The music was a perfect mix. And my girlfriend challenged me to have a drink of the cocktail menu instead of my usual tequila. I had the Raised With Wolves and it was great. One gurlfriend challenge down. My girlfriend, to go unmentioned had the "Something With Vodka" and that was even great. So looking at hitting this place after work in the future. A short Uber/Lyft ride but worth it. If I lived close by it would be my new favorite bar.
author: Richard B.

description:
Pretty cool spot in SoMa. It's easy to miss if you don't know exactly where it's at. They help that with the a projector that says Alchemist on the street right out front. 

The decor is really interesting. It's a rather kitschy SF bar, they sort of go for a steampunk theme, though I wouldn't say it's prevalent throughout the bar. Mostly on the walk up the stairs to the bar. 

I did love the projections they had going on he walls. Some short films were playing and they were kinda fun to watch every once in a while. 

The drinks were ok. I had an AMF and it was alright. Also had another drink (I can't remember what it was called) but it had essence of eucalyptus. Not bad but again it was just alright. 

I liked the vibe and I also liked that the bartender cut off some inebriated patrons when he felt they'd had too much. 

I'll be back for sure.
author: Nick D.

description: Such a great environment /vibe. My husband and I were looking for someplace (anyplace really) new to celebrate his promotion at work. We stumbled inside here as a detour on our way to the bar we originally planned on going to. And ended up spending the whole rest of our night here watching tv, drinking and talking!
author: Kristy G.

description:
Edited review: owner of bar messaged me with utmost concern and advised that one of the people who was so underwhelming is no longer with the establishment.  Would give it another try based on customer service from the owner.   

miserable bar staff - unresponsive while sitting at the actual bar - at 6pm when it's desolate.  why be called "alchemist" if you can't come up with a drink that doesn't taste like herbaceous earth.  zero suggestions made after them not having drinks i asked for.   cute decor and vibe but why not hire people with a shred of personality?
author: Sarah K.

description:
Love this spot, great beer choices + full bar!
Extremely friendly service, even though we were first time customers. 
only issue was parking was rather limited.
author: Janel P.

description:
I really like the vibe here.
Such a great place to hangout with your friends.
I usually not drink too much but I enjoy the time in this bar.
author: Jenny L.

description: A really unique bar - thoughtfully designed for a cool experience and drinks are pretty good
author: Maggie S.

description: Really easy to access, and just love the ambiance. Great martinis! If you are ever looking for a place to hang with girlfriends, great place to stop in. Also, the fish tacos are surprisingly good.
author: Laura G.

description:
We had scheduled a happy hour after work but we planned poorly and it was the same day as a daytime Giants game. (We work really close to the ballpark).   At the same as time we were on our way to happy hour, so were all the giants fans post game! We walked around and most places were super crowded with tons of already drunk people. We searched yelp for what other options were around and it was the Alchemist to the rescue! 

I think because of it's second floor location, and narrow dark hallway as an entrance - it is easy to just pass by and not even notice. The entrance is just a side hallway with some interesting decor - lab stuff, big old vintage book, an old record player. Go up the stairs and you are welcomed by high ceilings, and a refreshing amount of space compared to all the crowded first floor bars that the giants game fans go to. The space has an industrial warehouse vibe, with a twist of steampunk but not at all a steampunk bar. Crowd was calm and just seemed like a lot of after work drinks crowd. It was only a few people at the bar when we entered by two hours later we left and the place was packed. 

There is comfy lounge seating everywhere which makes it good for groups if you can get to the seating first. It has a good cocktail menu, beer selection. Happy hour options aren't anything special but they do have a happy hour. Limited bar bites like fries, tator tots - nothing special. Service was quick and efficient. Overall good option for drinks near the ballpark.
author: Veronica L.

description: Borden is the best!!!!!! He crafted the tastiest cocktails my girlfriend and I have ever had - AND he's super cute  will definitely be back.
author: Caroline Z.

description: The bar had a cool concept, loved the stairway entrance and the short films projected on the brick wall. Was not happy with the staff. Bar tenders were rude and very unhelpful. Was not impressed by the customer service provided.
author: Sandra A.

description:
So I got to say it was stinking hot up there on the second floor where the Alchemist cocktail bar and lounge are located, especially near the bar. I'm sure in winter time it's great but in the dead of summer not so much as our entire group was sweating due to the attic-like heat and warm air at the Alchemist. 
The cocktails were decent, a 3 is what I'm giving them. I ordered a Raised By Wolves which was by far their most interesting cocktail on the menu. It was good but none of the ingredients really stood out to me and it took nearly 20 minutes to get it made even though the bar wasn't all that busy. Is it always just me that seems to get the shaft when it comes to ordering a drink! Probably not just seems like it. 
I really like the brick wall that as you walk in where they are showing cartoons from a projector, one a modern day cartoon and another an old shadow puppet like cartoon projection, gotta say that was really cool, had hip-ster written all over this place. A nice spot to check out after a ballgame.
author: Matt D.

description: I reserved the elevated lounge for a bday party and it was a great experience!!! For the location and l how nice the decor is I think the prices are really good. I think our server's name was Candace and she was really nice, and since it was my bday she made my wish come true and played Hotline Bling just minutes after I requested it. I also appreciate that they don't have a bunch of TVs in the place--it helps people talk to each other. I like this place a lot!
author: Kyle L.

description: We initially had a good time there, but towards the end the service became very bad&rude. We bought several shots around 1:30am and had the notion that the place closes at 2:00am, but around 1:40am someone came to tell us very rudely that they were closing and we needed to leave right away. We asked for several minutes to finish our shots but he came again to force us to leave. Several shots were wasted which made the experience a negative one.
author: Frank F.

description: I really wanted to like this place after we went to dinner at 25 Lusk. The bar had maybe 15 people at about 9pm on a Wednesday night and their were two guys behind the bar last night. One black man and one white man. The white gentleman was not friendly and it took us a while to get his attention. He was more concentrated on making drinks for himself, tasting them, then dumping them out. I saw him do this at least 4 times. The lemon drop he made was horrible but he did make a good drink called the fashion victim. We will not be back. Bartenders are suppose to make you feel welcome and he certainly did not.
author: Robert W.

description:
I stopped by the alchemist after work on Friday with a friend to grab a drink! The atmosphere is really cool and it wasn't crowded at all! There is a bar downstairs as well as upstairs. The drinks are really good! I ordered the "Something with Vodka" and it was so good! It was also bright pink which I is extra fun with a flower to top it all off. The place has a very relaxed vibe it's exactly how you would picture a lounge. They have both couches for larger parties or tables if you want a more formal setting. It's an easy place to have a conversation while enjoying some good drinks. 

The bar tenders were not the friendliest but we were able to overlook that and just enjoy the atmosphere. This is definitely a trendy place if you are looking for something unique in the city!
author: Maddy H.

description:
Thoughtful, delicious drinks. We had Rum Is the New Bassline, made with tea, milk, cinnamon and other spices, guava, lime, basil -- it was complex but bright and such an interesting blend of flavors.  The Kalimera was made from yogurt and cucumber, lemon and herbs and I liked it because it was not too sweet and very refreshing.  They had some lovely non-alcoholic drinks as well.

Comfortable places to sit and not too crowded although I would have loved to have the music turned down just a little.  This is a great place to go after work with co-workers.

ADDITION TO ORIGINAL REVIEW:
Dear Phil C. --
I just read the very gracious reply you wrote to the review posted by Christina M.  Wanted to tell you that "soulless" is a completely inaccurate way to describe your place -- it has a lot of soul and I definitely got a sense of the personality behind the shadow animation, the welcoming seating and the appealing, creative drink menu. In this era of people lashing out at each other on social media, I was charmed by your kind response to a very negative (and in my opinion, unfair) review.  We just moved to SF, were so pleased to find the Alchemist and we will be back.
author: Ann S.

description: I went here on a date and it was very nice. It was a Thursday night so it wasn't too crazy, too loud or too crowded. They got nice comfortable seats and the menu item names made me giggle a little bit. The atmosphere was cool but I wasn't really my thing, although I do know a lot of people that would LOVE it. My review is actually for the staff. Everyone was extremely nice and easy to talk to and I felt comfortable ordering drinks (I have social anxiety). Even the security downstairs was super nice. I was also very easily entertained by the fairytale shadow puppet stories they have playing on the walls. I'd definitely come back again.
author: Mailalyn B.

description:
Pros: Spacious, good vibes, very well thought out decor, nice staff, plenty of seating 

Cons: Between 4 people we tried 5 of the signature cocktails, we found 1 (the millionaire #1) to be drinkable. The raised by wolves and another one with whiskey and tequila (can't remember the name) that was undrinkable. 

Bottom line: cool vibe, if you're not into bougie drinks this isn't the place for you
author: Molly C.

description: Really cool atmosphere and I could see hosting a neat theme party - but!!!! Drink menu is limited and service isn't very friendly or quick....
author: Zayka Z.

description: 10/10 experience. I planned a very large, last minute event here and the staff could not have been more helpful. Unique venue, great cocktails and great vibe. Small bites that were great.
author: Rachael K.

description:
Stopped in after work for happy hour on a Wednesday with a friend.  There was a nice crowd but still seats to be found.  It was not on a game day so I would imagine it's busier then.  They had some cool old school black and white films projected onto the exposed brick walls that went well with the quirky steampunk decor.  I was definitely a fan of the atmosphere.  They had some music playing but I don't remember what it was, must have been loud enough to drown out the other conversations but not too loud to be overpowering.  Good lightning for the scene.  I saw a few people eating some small snacks like tater tots and hummus but didn't see a food menu.

Now to the drinks.  The beers were reasonably priced for the neighborhood, $6 or $7 each for a bottle or can.  Not a huge selection but what they had was good.  The cocktail list was well balanced and $12 each. I've been on a Frenet kick lately so I asked the bartender to mix me something up that was Frenet forward and he did a great job. Something with scotch, (scared me at first), bitters and another ingredient I can't remember but it was great!  That's the sign of a great bartender.  The happy hour cocktails were overpriced and I saw one of the other bartenders rip the label off the well liquor they used.  Everyone knows the cheap drinks are using well liquor but I found it odd that they ripped the labels off.  I would have given this place five stars otherwise.     

4 beers and one cocktail, $38.  Not too shabby.  I'd go back again.
author: Scott M.

description: Cool vibe that captures your attention as you enter the place. Easy to miss the entrance to the staircase that leeds upstairs to the bar. It was not too busy on a Friday night, but good drinks and OK service. Liked the projector films that they run on the wall
author: Shayna M.

description: They have the classic sega! Mario Kart and street fighter! So dope! Place is decent sized but does get crowded especially after a night game or something. Their drinks are strrooonngg! Their background music wasn't bad either. A misture of top 40 and other throwbacks. I think the most memorable part of this bar is the classic antiques like video games available to play for their guests.
author: Jenna T.

description: Good bar, good space, small food selection. Cocktails are inconsistent depending on which bartender makes it. My girlfriends and I ordered the same drink and they all came out with different ice cubes, taste, and color. Despite that, it was still good cocktails, but not sure what we actually got.
author: Li N.

description:
Came with a friend on a Saturday night. It was a little empty inside, but had just enough people to give it a relaxed vibe. The decoration and projections on the wall were intriguing, and occasionally a little heavy, but they gave the place a unique draw. 

The price is what you would expect for an SF bar, about 13 for a cocktail. 

The staff were all very friendly without being annoying. One of the bartenders made a custom drink for my friend that blew both our socks off and he happily gave us the recipe on our receipt. 

Definitely worth checking!
author: Eric H.

description: Loved it! From out of town and my sister comes tomorrow. Definitely bringing her here. Great drinks and cool decor!
author: Jamie M.

description:
I love the ambiance of this place! Came here on a Saturday night to meet up with friends and I was surprised to see how open of a space it was even when it was full. We were able to sit on the couches and enjoy the good music that was playing. Deeper in SOMA so it's not as packed as a lot of the places in Fidi which I really enjoyed. It's also a place where you can hold a decent convo without the music blasting way too loud. 

Classy place! I will need to come back to try their Happy Hour.
author: Keizzel C.

description: Love the place. The bar tenders are always attentive, the projections above the bar are fun, but not distracting and the happy hour is great!
author: Adriana A.

description:
For a shy guy like me who can't even talk for half a minute at other bars, Alchemist is like Disneyland for me... Where magic happens. I kept talking and cracking jokes. Even I was surprised by myself. The cozy indoor setting and decoration, plus the dim lighting yet a bit of sunlight created the magical comfort for everyone to have a great time.

My friends and I went on a Friday for happy hour before heading to AT&T stadium for a Tech Expo. To prove I am shy, I ordered a non-alcoholic cocktail to start. I even forgot the name. But it's ok. After a few laughs, I am into the occasion. Here it came the $3 Tecate can. Then another cocktail. My friend ordered the cheesy dip and steak skewers. Both are awesome.

Right environment + right friends + right drinks = Magic!
author: Hoki T.

description: Like this place on a weekday. Spacious calm and chill. Wish they had a better wine menu.
author: Mary N.

description: We were surprised it wasn't super packed on a Saturday night. Entrance is a bit hard to miss, but they do have a projection of the sign. It's a dark, chiller vibe in the bar, but the cartoon projections were pretty cool. Drinks were great! We have two - one was a plum and Japanese whisky of some sort and it was REALLY good, as well as a orange flavoured drink. Not sure what the names were, but the two drinks we ordered were great! Great service as well.
author: Rebecca H.

description:
Alchemist is a relatively quiet bar located above Woodbury. It was still light when we arrived, which felt a tiny bit odd considering the dark decor and loungey setting. It was a weeknight and there was only one bartender. He was not in a rush and he also didn't seem to care about payment. I'm pretty sure we could've gotten away with free drinks if we wanted to.

We would never do that, right? Happy hour is all night on Mondays and and until 8 on other week nights.
author: Yi Z.

description: Cool bar with cool vibes. It's definitely a trendy spot good for larger groups. They also have happy hour 5-8 weekdays. I enjoyed the decor and overall atmosphere that it carried a ton; they were even playing projected short clips on the walls!
author: Lucy G.

description: Alchemist reached out and apologized for my poor experience which I sincerely appreciated. Updating review and stars accordingly.
author: Eric L.

description:
A+ for hospitality. 

I'm just starting with my tour of all the great cocktail joints in the city (of which there are many!) and Alchemist sets the bar high. It's a bit noisy for my tastes, but I was able to find a stool on the corner of the bar and quietly enjoy a couple cocktails in solitude. The bartender on my side of the bar was on-the-spot with taking my order and welcomed me to the city with a shot of mezcal. 

The decor is welcoming; there's stools at the bar, standing areas some tables and also some nice couches to meet with larger groups of friends. Projectors light up the brick walls with interesting shadow pictures. Some thought clearly went in to the design and flow of the floor layout and this is a great spot to check out if you're in SoMa.
author: Leo I.

description:
This place has been on my radar for awhile and I am so happy that I finally got a chance to come here for some drinks. I came here on Friday night around 10pm, there was no cover and no line. The ambiance and vibe of this place is incredible, from the moment you start walking up the staircase, you are greeted with painted walls and antique decor. You can see the amount of time that has been spent on the furnishing of this place. Once you get upstairs, the floor plan really opens up. The venue was surprisingly big, with a lot of different areas for seating, tables as well as big comfy couches and fancy chairs. They were projecting movies on the wall which was pretty cool, and kept me entertained while my friend was getting us drinks. I was also able to snag a couch with no problem. The venue did get more packed as the night went on, but never so much that you felt uncomfortable. It is a perfect venue for a relaxed night out, or a good starter bar before a crazier night out.

The only reason I deducted a star was for the service, the bartender I was ordering from was not friendly at all. When I asked him for recommendations, he was hesitant and wouldn't even tell me what was more popular between the drinks I inquired about. I understand if the bar was busy and he had a bunch of people waiting, but it was early enough in the night that i was the only person ordering at that time. But overall, once I had my drinks I enjoyed the atmosphere of this bar a lot and will be coming back.
author: Anita S.

description:
The Alchemist is a solid spot in SOMA on 3rd street for happy hour, games, or late nights.

I've been here 4 times now and each time has not disappointed. It was my first time again this past Thursday since they opened in 2012 and it was just as a remembered layout/ambiance-wise, but it was even more lively!

They have added "bites" to the menu which is great for game days. They're known for cocktails but now also have wine by the glass and beer by the pint.

Overall, a sexy lounge that's perfect for a night out with friends or even just grabbing a quick drink/bite after work/before a game.
author: Veronica S.

description: Best spot for high-end cocktails - stylish vibe, cool people. Always a great atmosphere. The bartender's here take great pride in their drinks, and it shows. Always coming up with cool drinks, interesting new flavor combinations, and unique techniques.
author: Melissa D.

description: Great speakeasy meets steampunk atmosphere.  The cocktails are all super fancy and delicious as well.  A great spot to end a date night.  A little pricier than I consider for a regular weekly thing, but it is definitely a great choice for when you want to do something a slight notch above casual.
author: Amy X.

description:
A little schizophrenic in its identity but Alchemist Bar & Lounge can be a decent spot for post work drinks. 

I definitely much prefer it to the crowds in Woodbury below but it can also fill up later in the week. I really appreciate the eclectic charm of the furniture and decor as well as the shadow puppet foreign films that they project on the walls especially when paired with the sounds of Postmodern Jukebox. I have however been here when they've been blasting fist-pumping beats which is a disconnect. The offer of run in/run out fireball shots at the entrance on game day definitely compounds the disconnect. With that said, service has typically been pretty good here and we've managed to find seating for even larger groups. You can call ahead and reserve the separate little nook overlooking the bar. I also like that they offer bottles of Erdinger here. 

It's a decent bar in the neighborhood where its second floor location can be a big plus when all the other watering holes around are packed wall to wall. Walk up and take a peak... you just might like it.
author: Jon L.

description:
A visit to The Alchemist brought upon a revelation of sorts.

First, silhouette movies aren't so bad to watch since they're just like silent movies minus color. Silhouette movies played all night against their brick backdrop walls.

Second, you shouldn't pass up spots that aren't flashy noticeable or immediately eye-catching. This is The Alchemist - I nearly passed it up.

The entryway is quietly located on the lower level where the security is posted to check your ID. He sends you up the stairs once he's verified you're of age.

Up you go into the darkness that is red all around you and head towards the left towards the bar. Order up a Happy Hour drink during 6-8pm or other libation and park yourself at the bar, cocktail tables or on one of their oversized comfy couches while you watch a silhouette film or happily converse with the company you came with. 

The music they play loops throughout your stay as well. However, they do get a pass on this cuz when you're playing jams from Whitney Houston, you can loop that sh*t all night if you ask me!

I like it here. It's cozy, warm. I had their Berry Moscow mule and a couple Sculpin IPAs. Beers are canned or bottled though. No beer on tap. Whiskey maybe...
author: Cat V.

description:
Great setting for drinks with friends, and really whimsical films of cutout characters projected onto the walls. A bit loud for a conversation, but opens until late. 

Drinks were just ok, but a good place to gather for happy hour.
author: Cynthia X.

description:
This bar is across from where I live so I decided to check it out with a group of friends. We really enjoyed our time here and I am definitely planning to come back!

+ Less crowded than other bars like Novella
+ Great cocktails and drinks! The bartenders are skilled and friendly.
+ Good prices - most drinks are $12
+ Fun mix of music 
+ Plenty of seating on a Friday night 

I would highly recommend stopping by if you're in Soma!
author: Sophia H.

description:
Lovely, somewhat gothish decor, and two stories high.

That's the end of this place's charm.

Is it just me, or do the bartenders come across as incredibly bored and act like customers are just a nuisance? Drinks don't stand out either.

Bored to death here. Not sure if I care to return, unless if someone invites me to.
author: Jo W.

description: Cool lounge and great drinks! They are on the pricier side, so savor each sip! The decor is really awesome, and it surprisingly gets crowded in the night.
author: Janet H.

description:
It's Friday night after baseball and the crowds are having fun.  $12 cocktails seemed to be the norm these days, it's alright.  Cost of SF living.
I've been here when things are more quiet and you can actually lounge on the chairs and have a decent chat.  
It's got the ambiance to be a cozy dive, but can accommodate the crowds when it has to.
author: Drew B.

description:
A co-worker of mine decided to go to this lounge so we followed him. It was kind of difficult finding this place at first because it was dark and just guessed the entrance. We were met with a friendly bouncer and allowed us to go in. You have to go upstairs to go into this bar.

As soon as we entered the bar, the vibe was definitely not for me. It was boring, in my opinion. Although, I did appreciate the aesthetics of the bar and velvet-coated walls.
author: Aj C.

description: Love the space, love the drinks. Have always been here when it wasn't too crowded. Excellent cocktails and love that it's so close to Caltrain.
author: Yin H.

description:
Was next door and decided we needed a change of scenery. Alchemist, here we come! Ended up finding a table by the shuffleboard and grabbed a couple of cocktails.

Cocktails ($11 each):
*BA baracus: scotch, lemon, ginger & habanero syrup, cider
*Along came sherry: bourbon, fino & px sherry, maple, coffee, bitters
*Smoking with the devil: mezcal, ruby port, agave, egg, lime, hellfire tincture
*Total eclipse: cynar, coffee liqueur, simple syrup, lemon juice, hum liqueur

I was super tired, so I started with the Total eclipse. Not sure why I thought it would have coffee in it. I guess I was too tired to really read the description. My second cocktail was Smoking with the devil. I wanted something light and refreshing. This did the trick as it reminded me of a pisco sour. The other two drinks were Peter L's.

We also got a Strawberry gimlet, which was nice and light. My gf and I had seen the strawberry basil gimlet pic which looked so pretty and delish. They just made us the strawberry version though.

I played shuffleboard which was super fun. Make sure to sweep all the sand off the board before you start. I think the sand affects the way the piece moves. Also be careful of the wall art next to the game. I ended up scratching and bruising my shoulder when I bumped into it. Ouch!

The turnoff of this place was it smelled when we walked in. Like someone had a little too much to drink and couldn't hold it in. Kinda grossed me out when we came in. Glad we were able to find that table on the other side of the bar.

Fun, but a little divey.
author: Elena N.

description: A cool, dark, steampunk-y, kinda fancy cocktail bar on the second floor of a building right near AT&T Park. The cocktail menu isn't huge but it has some very unique drinks on there. The liquor selection is solid and the draught and canned beer selection was pretty unique as well. The service was a but slow bit not awful for nicely made, fancy cocktails and the prices were reasonable for such drinks.
author: Jeffrey S.

description: This bar is very different and cool. Has a good selection of music and old school selection of motion pictures playing on the wall. The drinks are pretty pricey but also good. You get what you pay for.
author: Kyle T.

description: Went here for a surprise birthday party over the weekend. It was your typical bar scene upstairs. Loud music, really really hot. Overall, it was lots of fun, but nothing special.
author: Priya B.

description: Pretty chill place and at least we could get a seat on a Friday night. Kind of awkward seating and lots of greasy bar food. Waitress was relatively inattentive.
author: Andrew K.

description: The alchemist is my favorite place in soma. Ramon's drinks are the most amazing drinks. Rah is the best.
author: Layne C.

description:
Overall I will give this place 
I tried many cocktails here , their gimlets are good ...  Strawberry gimlet , cucumber gimlet and u can get one with mixed taste too ... It was on sweet side and well balanced 
Devils drink , beez nuts , bourbon ... All were good 
Mixologist is good here ... They do full justice to Any Drink , which is on menu ... With right amount of spiciness , sweetness n sourness 
2 things which I didn't like here were ... I asked for mojito (not in menu ) and it was one of the worst mojito ... So my suggestion don't go for cocktails outside their menu ... And they have very less sitting ... They need to get few more table or chairs will do good too . 
I will definitely come back to this place on any given day
author: Anshul G.

description:
This place is phenomenal! The decor was really well done and reminded me of a Jack Skellington. There were eerie-looking trees and silhouette projections displayed on the brick walls. 

The drinks were also really yummy and creative. It wasn't too crowded, it was the perfect ratio of personal space and number of people to socialize with.  

Overall, this bar was unique and edgy and I would definitely recommend it!
author: Melissa A.

description: I loved the ambience of this place (esp. the shadow puppet projections on the walls!) and my drink (Fashion Addict or something like that). However, the bartender was very gruff and the place was quite dead on a Saturday evening - so docking a point for that.
author: Priyanka G.

description:
Huge fan of the ambience here. It's trendy, cosy and just plain comfy! My husband and I like to sink into the couches with a beer to unwind after a long day of work. 

The crowd is pretty young, but this place never gets too rowdy or loud.
author: Rie U.

description:
REVIEW #299.  Which can count as #300 depending on your significant figures.

Does chemistry occur chez the Alchemist?  I don't know, because all good chemistry pickup lines argon.  

I've wanted to come here for awhile because I've heard it is comparable to Local Edition, though the primary reason is my affinity for all things science-related--theLab, DNA Lounge, and now the Alchemist. 

I half-expected a chemistry lab theme, which would be quite swanky with dranks prepared with pipets, mixed in flasks, and served in beakers.  (This was actually one of my musings for what I would do for a living had I not gotten accepted into pharmacy school).  I was therefore ecstatic to be greeted by flasks, microscopes, and other paraphernalia that blur the lines of witchcraft and alchemy.

[THE AMBIENT CONDITIONS]

If you want to take a picture of the fascinating labware setup in order to look cool on social media (yes I confess being guilty to this practice), there might not be time becuase the bouncer is very efficient and the line moves surprisingly quickly.  He paused on me for awhile though; I guess pharmacy school hasn't made me age too much... yet. 

Up the obligatory staircase for the imitation speakeasy experience, the main room wasn't exactly the nerdy chemistry bar of my dreams, but the unique ambiance was primarily warehouse, blended with electric and intellectual elements.  One might describe it as entropy: disorder in perfect natural order.  The overlooking second level is obliquely designed like a haphazard makeshift platform, and the vintage edison bulbs, brick walls, and projections of black-and-white videos only add to the charm.  

[THE WAVELENGTHS]

The music selection is solid: all the songs on the radio that I don't skip over.  It's a mix of popular/EDM minus annoying girly songs.  Overall the noise is at a good level, loud enough to feel alive but not so loud that you have to scream to hear yourself think.

[THE EtOH]

I half suspect the bartenders to be fans of My Chemical Romance, which would explain the name Alchemist as well the fact that all the cocktail names are so morbid.  Death in a Rose Garden and Smoking with the Devil sound like something straight out of the Black Parade.

I got the B.A. Baracus (scotch, lemon, ginger & habanero syrup, hard cider), and it was crafty enough to be worth the $11.  I especially liked the spicy kick, which went well with the scotch.  It was just the right level of spiciness to give it character without being flamboyantly firey and barely tolerable like the Local Edition Bloody Mary.  Because we were trying to identify what we ordered, I tried a sip of some other cocktails, and all were wonderfully complex.  

I also appreciated how artsy the cocktails looked, with the thin layer of foam up to the rim, simple elegant garnishes, and a large ice cube curiously floating pointy side up (reminiscent of the half-sunk marshmallow in the $7 mocha named Titanic at Hollow).

[THE KINETICS]

Oh snaps the shuffleboard.  It's quite entertaining over dranks, with all the spontaneity.   Unlike the cumbersomely strategic game of pool involving vectors, transfer of momentum, etc. etc, the nature of the game is such that there isn't much you can control given the variability from the sand and the sloped surface.  It's something of a crap shoot, essentially an adult version of beer pong.
author: Edna C.

description: I have only been here a few times but its one of my husbands fav. bars. I decided to reserve a space for his bday and it was awesome. The communication with Phil the owner was great and he is so accommodating. The drinks tasted great! I recommend this bar for a party or get together.
author: Mary D.

description: Nice open space at the bar area with three couch seating sets that are great for groups. It's a good spot for happy hour with co-workers.  Very close to CalTrain.  Bar bites were tasty too - I enjoyed the fried chicken sliders and fish tacos.  One thing to note:  Getting to this location from other parts of the city can be a pain with the ongoing construction and major rush hour traffic at 5pm.  I live in Russian Hill and was meeting friends at 5pm there and it took me 25 minutes to get down there...
author: Louise K.

description:
Hey! Mister bartender!!! Its not ok to give me the side eye just because I asked if you can make a cucumber/strawberry gimlet. If you can't. Then don't. Don't make me feel bad? 

Ugh. Although the drink was pretty delicious. Minus the attitude :/
author: Michelle I.

description: We had a great time here on Friday Office Christmas 2016 afterparty; the up-the-stairs little balcony-lounge area for 10 of us was the best spot u can imagine to occupy in this bar. Thank u.
author: Svetlana K.

description:
Alchemist Bar & Lounge is 2oz craft cocktails,  1/2 oz good music,  1/2 oz lounge chairs and actual seating. Stirred direct over 2nd story Soma/South Beach views. Garnish with no cover and you have a drink for success.

All I heard this past weekend on the radio was Hyphy, Trap and Justin Beiber and despite keeping myself busy by eating and drinking my way across the Bay I kind of wanted to get back to my roots, my peoples, a craft cocktail bar. I was a little tiki'd out and the beer up here is not as good as back home. SF is arguably where I got my craft cocktail start back in the day at B&B, Rickhouse and though I usually check out the latest and greatest, my friends suggested something for the whole group.

It's a connected bar at the bottom of the stairs to a sports bar, neighborhood space with video games, but we wanted to go upstairs where the music was. 90's, 2000's, R&B, Hip Hop. No DJ tonight, but the set up is in the back by the mens room. The dance space is small and right down the middle flanked by the lounging couches and area on the far wall and the bar. A small alcove loft has some more private areas, but it's loud so it forces some intimate proximity just to talk. Brick walls, tall ceilings, very flat/loft esque with wood floors and tables, coat/purse hooks. A dozen seats around he bar are pretty comfortable, but as the bar gets slammed you will feel the crush of 2-3 deep. Bathroom is small, but has large stalls.

Just looking at their bottles on shelf they have everything you'd expect, fresh fruits, citrus, syrups, cordials, orgeat and a variety of rums for tiki (smith & cross, Hamilton, flor de cana), a few dozen whiskies/bourbons as well as amaros. 

My night here, the point station was run by who I think was the manager, obviously knew his way around a bar, but not this station, was a little slow on the recipe's. I could tell Simon at the service station usually ran point based on which hand he grabbed the bitters, well bottles and mixes. I went to him and patiently waited as he served female after female and string ordering sports jacket wearing ex hipster after string ordering sports jacket wearing hipster. A quick chat and a few tips later I had my drinks, some free shots and connect. No Henny, so we went with their Martel XO Cordon Blue, which I warned my friends would cost a pretty penny as it's between VSOP and Paradis. Negroni, 2 cognac & Mexican coke's were $47. I went with a mezcal & green chartreuse with a smith & cross daiquiri back. My next round was a vieux carre, a shot of fernet, then some Rittenhouse. My buddy wanted a surfer on acid which hey couldn't make, so I improvised the recipe using branca menta, plantation rum and pineapple. A hit. They have pebble ice and their cold draft machine is on point. Bar back looks like he's on his 2nd 5 hour energy. They are definitely short about 1 waitress and probably need to rope off the service area. Tip your bartender people, it goes along way.

Even someone like me can find it hard to hit up all your favorite spots, which now have waits and with so many places to try I'm glad I found somewhere I can add to my list for good drinks, good music and a non pretentious vibe.
author: Walter M.

description: Went to The Alchemist before the Gaga concert to meet friends for drinks. It has a cool vibe and a nice space but nothing totally special. They have some craft cocktails on the menu but it's not very expansive.  Good spot for a drink before a Giants game or concert at AT&T. Some bar food options are available although we didn't have anything. The Woodbury is downstairs and has a kitchen w more food options along with their bar.
author: Kay C.

description:
Came here on a Friday night with one of my sisters and one of my nephews. We met up after work and I was happily surprised to see that it wasn't overly packed. Not sure how busy it gets during a game night but I'm sure it can get super full! The last thing I want to do after a long week/day at work is head into a super noisy crowded bar, so this was perfect. Yes they were busy but we could breath. We could hear each other talk. We were able to sit. We were able to order drinks without waiting forever or screaming out what we wanted. 

The drinks were good! Thanks to the good bartenders :)

Staff were appropriately attentive. I loved the silhouette movies playing on the brick backdrop walls! Everything in here was just comforting. Sophisticated and sleek, but not at all intimidating. Nice music, can't remember what at the moment but it was good (popular top 40 music is played here).  I'll be back!!!
author: Maya N.

description: I'm going 5 stars on this place. Super cool looking, upscale feel, lounge with a bar, good happy hour at a decent price, great location, great vibe, AND good, professional service? It's a must.
author: Keagan G.

description:
The furniture here is great for just chilling for the night. Bartenders are fast and make strong drinks. The only thing that trips me out is the Nightmare Before Christmas animation that plays on the brick walls. Super trippy in I'm not sure is a good way? 

Minus that, a solid place to chill.
author: Destini M.

description: I did not have any of these drinks, but am looking forward to having a few beverages here. The mixologist are super cool, nice and experienced. Ambiance is nice, decor is very cool and the drinks look perfectly cured.
author: David C.

description: We stopped in here for a drink at the end of our night out in San Francisco. We had just been at the woodbury next door (a sister property) and figured we should check it out. The music was good and the vibe was upbeat and fun. The entrance is located on the lower level with a doorman who checks ID.   Not much to look at in the entrance so I was happy to see it was nicer when you went upstairs. The interior has brick walls and gives off the vibe of hipster, speakeasy without the attitude (everyone we encountered was really nice and pleasant). This place is known for craft cocktails but I was the only one in our party to grab a beer and skip the fancy stuff. Everyone was happy with their cocktails and they have a good beer selection.    I would definitely come back through here another time (we had one drink and then it was last call).  Worth a visit.
author: Melanie D.

description:
Tis' the season.

For uggs, scarves and everything pumpkin spice.

Call me basic, but these are "basic" essentials to not only weather this season but to experience it fully.

But get this: I don't own uggs (aka UGHS), I don't wear scarves and until this past weekend I have never had a pumpkin spice latte.
Oh but when I did, my world was flipped upside down immediately. Granted, we had a gift card which helped me justify this impulsive splurge but still, fantastic. I get it white girls, I can't even either.

That night, we hit the town ready to cause mischief with some Oakland friends. We found the Alchemist via yelp and were initially intrigued because of the video games and seemingly chill atmosphere; We didn't wanna wade through union square tourists nor give off dirty glares to the mission folk, so the lesser of evils sat in SOMA.

The Alchemist is a beautiful space. Large, home-y and festive enough (note: maybe they have the x-mas lights up all year?). we found a seat at the bar and were happy to find an abundance of great beers and crafty cocktails. I started with the Steelhead DBL IPA which was hoppy and full of flavor.... Definitely helped kick the night off in the right direction. After some talk and banter about my pumpkin spice experience, the night took a turn for the best.

I found the BasicBitch cocktail.

Imagine this: pumpkin spice latte in cocktail form. From what I recall, it was made with whiskey and pumpkin spice liquor with some bitters.  I lost my phone the night before (like a basic bitch should) so I was unable to capture the picture.... Or the menu to take note of its ingredients.... But dear god, this hit the spot. It was warm, it was full of flavor and by the third one I found myself nuzzled up in a corner wearing yoga pants and uggs.

After reading reviews and looking at photos, I've come to conclude that this art of a cocktail is seasonal (obvi) so get it while you can. 

Basic bitches, UNITE!
https://media1.giphy.com/media/ENMWsXKe9EBAA/200.gif
author: Ryan L.

description: Alchemist is my top places to have a drink when im out and a out in SF. The vibe is always good and the mixed crowds always bring up a lively atmosphere. I came out with my Fiancee on a Friday night and we had a blast. Our bartender (Will) was absolutely the best!!! The cocktails he made were so damn good and he worked fast to serve everyone. He also got a lot of orders for other people around us who were very pleased and highly impressed with his service and quality. Most bars in SF rush the service and the drinks are mediocre at best, but Alchemist got it right. If its your first time at look for Will and he "Will" not disappoint. Kudos to Will and the Alchemist staff. Also don't skip out on the artichoke dip and deviled eggs.
author: John O.

description:
Very cool rustic SF style bar.  Great drinks and service too.
Very nice location.
author: Anupam D.

description: This bar wasn't too bad... I went Saturday night and had a couple of drinks.... The emerald tablet was pretty good made out of ford gin and a touch of pistachio juice.... It wasn't very sweet but at the same time tasted like juice ... Must had been a creeper drink!
author: Joyce K.

description:
Such a great spot for after work drinks or a low key night with friends. 

Ambience is great and the cocktails are innovative and delicious. There's even shuffleboard if you get bored of just drinking and talking. It's a tad bit pricey but to be expected in this neighborhood.
author: Gowri R.

description: Very interestingly unique atmosphere with pretty good music that interchanges between oldies and fun hiphop music The drinks are very nice and service is great despite the Friday night crowds. The lounge areas are perfect for your group of friends to have a space together, I know our crew enjoyed our area ;) Overall great experience.
author: K. J.

description:
Met another couple here after seeing the Kurious CdS show. Picked the worst possible time to come here as there was a very large corporate group (75 or more) complete with name tags when we arrived. Add in the regulars and visitors and it was packed to the point of barely being able to move.
Through it all the bartenders were quick, responsive and friendly and the old fashions  wine and cava were good and a bargain during Happy Hour.
Left after a drink but giving Alchemist 4 stars as the crazy crowd wasn't their fault and the bartenders kept up with the frenzy.
Would definitely come back to give Alchemist another try.
author: Tom D.

description:
Disclaimer: review is only for upstairs. 

The first thing that comes to mind is that it's SO HOT UPSTAIRS.  With crowds of people and alcohol flowing, that doesn't help :(  They have nice music and a cool shuffleboard up there, but I start sweating immediately.  Also, they were out of Jameson when I ordered a Jameson and Ginger...whaaat? It was only 11..

I've heard downstairs is cooler with a lot of games, but there's almost never anybody there.  The party is definitely upstairs.  Overall, it's not a bad place to have some fun and drinks.
author: Steph S.

description:
This may be one of my favorite bars in the SF! The drinks just have so much character.

I got the I'm Not Daisy, but it was a bit too sweet for me. My friends got the Camp Fire Fix(?) and Smoking with the Devil, and it tastes exactly as it sounds!! I'd recommend this place if you want drinks that taste different. At least give it a try eh?
author: Vivian W.

description:
If you're looking for a mix of techies, hipsters, and techie hipsters, then this is the place to go. The atmosphere is dark and trendy, complete with brick walls and hardwood floors. The music is loud enough to drown out any awkward silences, and the lighting is dark enough to significantly improve your physical appearance. There are even old silent animated shorts projected onto the walls, which provide a decent talking point if you really can't dredge up anything from your stash of conversation topics.
**Conclusion: Great place for a first date!**

On a more serious note, Alchemist is one of my favorite bars in the city. Its convenient location in SoMa (so close to AT&T Park!) is great for people looking to unwind after a long day of work, or grab a drink after a Giants game. The price is reasonable for the city ($11/cocktail), and the cocktails are delicious. If you like sweeter drinks, the Shrub Down is your best bet. They also have a different cocktails every week (changes every Tuesday), so you don't get stuck with the same drinks every time you go. 

No, there are no beers on tap... If you prefer a rowdier, more beer-centric crowd, simply head downstairs to Woodbury and you'll be greeted with delicious beers (served in mason jars, hah), food, TV, and video games (Street Fighter and Pac-Man). The two places are actually owned by the same people. 

I'll definitely be back again soon -- the combination of Alchemist and Woodbury is too great to pass up. See you there next Friday! ;-)
author: Christine L.

description:
came here this past monday with a friend, and the place actually had more of a crowd than expected!  i've driven past this spot a few times, so glad to have a chance to try their cocktails. 

i ordered a strawberry / vodka one that was pretty delicious, then got two mojitos after that, which was weird because..they tasted different! haha. not sure what happened. i will be back to try more cocktails given the extensive list, and there is a happy hour before 8 pm, which is nice! 

the ambiance is pretty cool, old school with leather arm chairs and all. there is a film projected on the wall, so that was entertaining.  also want to try woodbury downstairs teehee.
author: Christina L.

description:
When I first moved to SF, I lived in SOMA for awhile. SOMA is sometimes not a super awesome place because its kind of dead. This place is a little bit hidden, but go upstairs and the steampunk facade is a great place to unwind or catch up with friends after work, for birthday drinks or just to hang out, have a drink and watch the pretty awesome black/white Canadian shorts on the projector. 

On the weekends it can get a bit rowdy, but the weeknights are pretty tame and actually very comfortable to catch up with friends, etc.

Will, the bartender, is also awesome and super friendly. Give him a big tip anytime you see him.
author: Lai-Nin W.

description:
Came here for drinks after a late dinner nearby.

The space is cool, and the drinks were well made, but I didn't really dig the vibe or the crowd on the night we were here.
I don't know what it's usually like, since this was my first time here, but something just didn't work for me.

The bartender was pretty quick, prices were standard for the area and quality.

The music is LOUD and totally not my kind of music.

We left after one drink and headed downstairs to Woodbury.
author: Amanda G.

description:
Great bar in the SOMA with yummy and inventive cocktails - $11-13 range (everything on the menu looked really good) - even the beers were 'fancy' - No Stella or Coronas here!
The bartenders weren't working too fast but this is a place where they actually put good work and ingredients in your cocktail so that's probably why.

The bar was not huge but it wasn't crowded so it felt spacious. There was tons of standing room everywhere with lots of places to put down your drink. I hate when you have to hold on to your drink. Overall, it felt clean (no sticky floors or tables!).

The crowd was pretty diverse and fairly young (mid20-early 30's). No strict dress code. No rachets (if you're looking to get turnt, this isn't the place for you!) More so chatting and mingling. Being 'classy' I suppose.

Music was ok. I forgot what they played. I think it was a little mix of everything.

I'd come again for a quick drink or two. But not to partay.
May be good for small get-togethers though!
author: Emily C.

description:
Loved this spot! We originally were going to the place downstairs, but didn't appreciate the vibe. Alchemist was more our pace, less d-bags upstairs that night. 
It's dark inside (kind of warm too on a warmer day) - bartenders chill - and the drinks were great. We sat at the counter, and had a few. Definitely would come back.
author: Amy O.

description:
This place has a great atmosphere. It was surprisingly easy to get a table even on a weekend. It's dark, and the drinks are ready fast. 

The drinks aren't that strong, but they taste delicious. The staff is also friendly and we never had to wait for more than 5 min to get a drink. I will definitely drop by if I'm back in the area. It is nicely located near where I stayed last time.
author: Jeffrey Z.

description:
After a very unfortunate first experience at Alchemist, I had all but written off this new SoMa lounge.  Fortunately, the owner was incredibly helpful and was able to recover our stolen jackets, so I have renewed faith.  

Alchemist is two blocks from my place in a neighborhood desperately needing a change of pace from the divey Giants bars - so I want to like it. Sadly during my first visit, my three of my friends and I all had our jackets taken.  Of course this isn't the bar's fault (though it would be concerning if it's a regular occurrence), but we were very disappointed with the way they handled it.  

In particular, when asked if they had moved our jackets, one bartender barked, "I don't know, that's not our problem, we're closed.  Please head out."   He and his colleagues were not interested in helping us and only wanted to get us out of the bar.  This is the same individual who first greeted us a few minutes earlier with "You have 30 seconds to chug that, and get out of the door, we're closing."  

When the owner learned of the incident, he reached out to help.  Together, we were able to determine that another large group that night had left with all of our coats (thinking they were left by their friends).  They then returned the jackets, and now we are warm again during SF's chilly summer.

As is often true, it only took one incredibly rude staff member to completely ruin the night, but it also took only one incredibly helpful person to save it.   I just hope the jerk isn't with Alchemist for long so I can come back and give it a second shot.
author: Greg B.

description:
I love this place. It's such a hip place to be on Thursday thru Sunday evening. I especially like it on Thursday night. My last visit was just before Halloween and it was packed with people wearing their most ridiculous Halloween costumes. 

But not only is it a place for the hip, I usually choose this place for my first dates...yes, perfect for taking that new someone. The staff is easygoing (not in your face all the time), the atmosphere is mellow so you can sit on one of their couches and have a good conversation. The bartender is great with his liquor and whenever I'm confused on what to choose he always surprises me with something new. 

This place is my all-time go to place when I just wanna take a date or just friends for an evening of drinks and good time.
author: Tré S.

description: This place actually pretty interesting. My friends an I came here for a birthday and ended getting a couple free shots. Bartenders looks to be really layed back which made it easier for us to relax as well.  The place is interestingly decorated with a couple cool projectors on the walls, giving you feeling of a theater. I would definitely visit this place again. I would definitely remove drinks from the menu if they are not served all night, especially on a weekend.  Other than that everything went awesome.
author: Eduardo C.

description:
I wish San Jose had more scenes like these. Calm, cool, collected ambiance to grab a great cocktail and rest your feet on nice leather bound armchairs, which is definitely what we did.  

A very interesting place that was a cross between a library and a part warehouse feel. Not sure what that was. Upon walking in, you can already hear the music. It can be a little loud so come with close friends if you don't mind your personal space being invaded to hear each other over the music. The crowd was pretty mixed and mellow. Even with such loud music (there was a DJ that night), definitely no dancing.

Bartenders were polite enough, but could work on their interpersonal skills. Maybe we caught them on an off night. Who knows, but it would have been a more pleasant experience if our bartender cracked even a hint of a smile.

Why I like this place is because we intended to hop around SOMA area and at 11PM at night, definitely hard to find ANY parking. After about a dozen circles around the area with NO parking, we decided to come here with AMPLE parking.
author: Ling H.

description:
Cozy Vibe, cool decor.

Really Nice place for drinks, met some friends for a quick drink and ended up staying for hours.

Great music playing, whoever has the controls does a great job.

Very interesting light grafics, this makes it unique from other places i have been in the city like this.

Drinks are unique, I told the bartender what i like and he mixed me something even he had never made before. That was the coolest part.
author: R C.

description: Stopped by for some drinks before heading to the almighty restaurant Saison (just around the corner). While this place screams trendy with every hipster gimmick there (projected black/white artsy films on bare walls, craft drinks, dim light, inviting furniture to accommodate groups, stairway entrance, etc.), it is pretty fun for what it is and the exact thing that would keep me coming back. It's like there's a trendy formula nowadays for these types of establishments and although society makes fun of it, it's a cool environment to be in. I liked their drink list, the drinks themselves, and I like how they had this platform you can chill on and just people watch. This would be a nice place to either take a date, meet with a big group of friends, or just grab a drink and people watch.
author: Marlon T.

description: My friends and I planned a happy hour on Wednesday in SOMA, but forgot about the post-Giants day game craziness. The bar we had originally planned on going to was overflowing by drunk, screaming fans, so we quickly checked Yelp to see what else was in the area. Alchemist was the closest bar to us, and given the more high-brow cocktail feel, we hoped that it would be less crowded. We were so relieved when we walked into the dark, quiet, unassuming foyer, where the friendly bouncer checked our IDs and sent us upstairs. The foyer area was decorated with interesting vintage/industrial props like an old encyclopedia and record player.  Upstairs, the bar was surprisingly empty (it was around 5:45), and we found an empty corner with very comfortable leather couches. The decor of the bar is really industrial with exposed bricks, raw wood, and dark leathers.  It felt like the ultimate bachelor pad or something. Getting a drink at the bar was relatively easy and they had a good selection of happy hour drinks. I ordered a hendricks gin, cucumber and tonic drink that was super refreshing and not super boozy. My friends ordered other drinks from the menu, and we shared an order of tater tots. Within an hour, the bar was almost completely packed, so I was grateful for our couch area. I'm happy to have stumbled upon Alchemist, and I think it's one of the best (and most civilized) happy hour bars in the area.
author: Regina L.

description: Alchemist is fantastic!  The cool decor is inviting and edgy.  A perfect spot to chill after work while traffic dies down. Or to have your company party/gathering.  Super close to the ball park.  The clientele is not "divey" so you don't have to worry about some drunk picking a fight.  They always have a creative, and changing drink menu.  I have probably been here 8-10 times in the past couple years and it never disappoints.  Highly recommend.
author: Rob C.

description:
The bar was great and very spacious but what blew me over was the cute wall animations . It was unique and so cute. Completely upped the ambience and gave it an edge over so many other bars Iv been too.
Yummy cocktails , great vibe and overall a great place to hang out for a chilled out evening. They have yummy snacks too. Love the tater tots here.
Definitely coming back.
author: Nupur S.

description:
Ok overall. Music was ok, not very upbeat. No beer on the tap! 

Took forever for someone to come and clean our table. We went down to woodbury's and enjoyed it more
author: Hemant D.

description:
This review is for the Metrowize event where they offered $3 drinks. There were two private parties and the Metrowize going on. The service is usually horrific here because of their "artisanal" cocktails, which take a while to make. The bartenders on a normal night are stuffy a'holes to begin with too.
