description: Calm, laid back spot on weekdays. Perfect for a unique end of the night drink. We've always had an easy time acquiring the table to play a game of shuffleboard (this may be because we only come during the week). Bartenders are friendly enough and always craft a strong drink.
author: Kelly P.

description:
Date/Time:  Friday - 10pm
Occasion:   Lounging with friends
Party of:  Three
Ordered:  Something with Vokkah
Total incl. gratuity:  ~$12/cocktail

Fun speakeasy feel kind of lounge.  Very spacious and plenty of seating so for those who feel claustrophobic, this is your kind of place.  Drinks are well prepared and definitely pack a punch.  After drinking about 1/2 of my cocktail, I was already feeling a bit warm.  I thought the bartenders were very friendly and worked efficiently.

Since it's a fairly new place, it feels like they're still coming together on some things (ie. restroom, drink ingredients, etc).  I might give it another whirl in a few weeks to see where they're at.
author: Jess C.

description: Nice atmosphere.  Little empty sometimes.  Friendly bartenders and decent selection of booze.
author: Ryan C.

description:
Definitely our new go-to spot for happy hours!  I work at one of the Adobe offices right around the corner.  We've been here twice now for drinks and apps.  The owners are two of the nicest guys around and always take great care of us.  Very invested in the business, helping with serving drinks and food.  We took a new colleague there on his first day, yesterday (4/1) and he already declared it his new favoriate bar in the city.  Well done, Alchemist.  Looking forward to many more HH's.  

Other details: awesome decor and atmosphere, good apps from the restaurant below them, nice open space, great lounge area.  We went on a Thursday (got relatively crowded, but plenty of room to move around) and a Monday when it was pretty empty (which of course was great for us).  Mondays are nice to go if you want a little more room to yourself.
author: Matt L.

description:
I really wanted to hate this place just from the website when you hear mixologist and "bleed hospitality" in San Francisco it is usually a Marina side show with crappy drinks and poor behavior.  I actually walked away liking it.  Non-baseball night.

The room was cool and the decorations were actually quirky and interesting without being too kitchy.  Great spaces and nice feel to it.  Drinks were interesting.  We liked Shrub Down and the Vokaah.  Two other drinks were less than yummy but our "mixologist" was nice enough to notice we hated them and replaced our bad with good.  

Beer list is pretty awful and needs a lot more focus around being as quality as they strive for "top notch craft" and becoming an "incubator".  Time to make that thought fully integrated across the whole venue.

Staff was great.  Room would be cool to rent out (with my own beer list) and the theme is interesting.  Crowd it a bit odd but I am sure that will change and evolve as Baseball starts and people find the place.
author: Doreen D.

description: Meh. The drinks were interesting, but the service was poor and the place is perpetually filled with hipsters.
author: Peter G.

description: Swanky spot to have a good time with friends. It was my first time here and the drinks were awesome. The atmosphere is super chill and cool. Will definitely hit up this spot when I visit SF again!!!
author: Sweet F.

description:
These faux speakeasies have been popping up all over lately, and while I love Bourbon & Branch and like Local Edition, I can't help but feel a little burned out at the sudden resurgence of these places. 

That said, The Alchemist does make a tasty vodka cocktail and a pretty seriously strong old fashioned. The wine list only has four options (??), but the bordeaux is excellent. It does make for a nice alternative to the baseball dive bar scene, but little touches like leaving the window open to let the freezing wind in, seemed like the place had a lack of attention to detail. You probably can't do better in South Beach, but you can do better elsewhere.
author: Kevin B.

description: Horrible. The doorman was rude, the bartender was pretentious, the selection was terrible, and the atmosphere was desperately hipster. We came to this bar at the recommendation of an aquaintance and we were hugely disappointed. The bartender did not have the stock to make a midori sour, an apple martini, a white Russian,  or Irish coffee...what kind of bar is this?? To top it off the vodka martini he did make me tasted terrible and clearly contained low grade liquor. If you want a welcoming bar to have a nice relaxing drink in go anywhere else but this ill  equipped, hipster hell hole. We will never be back.
author: Alicia V.

description: Drinks are fine. The usual San Francisco craft cocktail deal. Unbelievably noisy on a Saturday night. The music was being played at club volume level. Very young techy crowd. Maybe 75% male. Felt kinda like a frat party or dance club for people with too much money who don't like dancing.
author: James S.

description:
Came here for a work happy hour. Love trying new places on a company tab, so my review may be a little swayed since I paid no attention to the prices. 

So glad this place has appetizers - I hate bars without food...it's asking for TROUBLE. Overall, best tater tots EVER. Classier than when you were a kid of course. They were so cripsy  and made me want to gorge on fast food for the rest of the night. 

Love the drink menu - it matches the dark, mysteriousness of the place. I had a Campfire Fizz - although not called that (It's the name on their online menu...I just can't remember the actual name). First time I had mezcal and boy was it SMOKEY. I also never had egg in an alcoholic beverage so it was interesting. The first few sips were nasty, but as a true trooper, I didn't waste alcohol and kept sipping. It eventually got really good! 

Next was a glass of chardonnay, can't go wrong. Proves that they have both normal and interesting drinks for everyone! 

Wings and crispy spring rolls were yummy too. 

This bar is upstairs and is very cool in general. I love the decor for the occasion - very Gatsby-like. I highly recommend trying it!
author: Mimi V.

description:
Loved it! Great place to have a gathering, in this case it was my birthday party. The ambiance and decor take you to another time. The drink menu was great, especially since they offer a tasty nonalcoholic option for my non-drinking friends.

The only reason they aren't getting five stars: the seating is spread out a bit too far so you can't hear people across the table, especially with the music volume.
author: Michelle R.

description:
Alchemist is across from my place so was happy to see a new bar open up. I drink more wine nowadays, but the wine selection is horrible so decided to order a cocktail. Here is how it went:

Me: "Rum and diet coke please"
Bartender: "We don't have diet coke"
Me thinking: WTF?
Me: How about cranberry and vodka
BT: "We don't have cranberry juice, we have pomegranite" 
WTF??!!

I appreciate bars are trying to focus on "mixology" but for a place that does not serve food, they should have diet coke and cranberry. 

Other than that the interior is cool and rustic.
author: Brian P.

description:
Love this place!  Great vibe and excellent cocktails.  I recommend that you try one of everything from the cocktail menu (even if it requires multiple visits).  The cocktails are very creative and well designed.  Each with a unique flavor and feel.

The B.A. Baracus (scotch, lemon, ginger & habanero syrup, cider) is one of my favorites.  The habanero syrup gives it a nice punch.  I like to follow it up with the refreshing, cooler taste of the Shrub Down (aged rum, amontillado, house shrub, lime, soda)

The Alchemist provides a comfortable lounge environment with plenty of seating, where you can easily find a table with friends to enjoy conversation and drink.
author: Brian M.

description: Well if you want to be ignored for wearing sports gear (if you aren't a friend) then don't go here. We were so excited to try this place only to be ignored the entire time. Way to go..hear great things..to not receive any service.
author: Alex G.

description:
I went here after a Giants game with my coworkers on Wednesday. We got there at 4pm, which happened to be when they opened.

Our cocktails were all good. They had a great selection of fun drinks. This is definitely another mixology bar.  The atmosphere is adorable....vintage leather couches, type writers, old vintage lamps, etc. Very speakeasy-ish. The bar was pleasantly light actually in the afternoon. The bar is on the 2nd floor and has nice large windows. Some people might not like this, but it suited our business crowd well. 

The bartenders were very nice. We were sitting in a lounge however, and we had to order from the bar the entire time. It would have been nice to have a waitress at some point. Maybe they have servers later at night. 

We were also able to order from a limited menu from the thai place downstairs. There were about 5-6 appetizers to choose from. Definitely not enough to fill you up by any means, but it was nice to snack on something. 

The reason for my lack of a star is that the place was virtually empty. I would not recommend coming here unless you are with a group of people. There was not any music, or many people, and no TV so your experience would be fairly lackluster.

A great new addition to SOMA though, I look forward to visiting again soon. I hope it gets more popular and becomes more crackin :)
author: Juliet S.

description:
I really like the vibe of the bar itself. The decor is cool, classy but not stuffy. There is weird shadow cartoon projection showing up on the wall behind one of the bars that I liked. The music sounds very 1920s and gives the place very speakeasy vibe.

Drinks are market rate (which is to say overpriced), but they were solid. I got a couple Moscow mules and they didn't stiff me on the liquor. Bartenders were nice.

That said, have a hard time giving it too high a rating because of the crowd. Super Asian, sorta yuppie, with a terrible male:female ratio. I know it's a bar in SF, and in startup center in Soma, but the ratio in here seemed especially horrible. I wasn't even on the prowl that particular night, I just found it hilarious and depressing looking around and seeing 2-3 guys talking to just about every girl in the establishment. Groups seemed pretty segregated as well, although I find that typical of SF.

If you're just looking for some nice artisan cocktails and are content to stick to your friends, I think this is a very solid spot. If you're looking to mingle and meet people, not an ideal spot.
author: David C.

description:
Very pretty setting with exposed brick walls and black and white film being projected on random walls. High Ceiling and defiantly a place that's nice for a chill but classy/hipster time on a weekday. Probably is a cool place when it is more crowded. 

Drinks are not bad, the bartenders fit in really well for the decor though. 

More of a place to go for how it looks rather than for the drinks themselves.
author: Taz H.

description:
Stopped here after the giants game and it was crowded but fun. Bartender was fast and attentive. There are these gothic videos playing against the brick walls which I actually liked and thought it was pretty cool. 

My only issue was that I didn't think the house drinks on the menu were very good. I had the vodka drink and it tasted like cucumber which isn't my favorite and my boyfriend and his friend didn't like their old fashioned that they ordered. 

I'll still give them 4 stars because it's a clean bar with attentive bartenders but I would recommend a change to their drink menu
author: Lauren P.

description: Best bacon wrapped shrimp skewers I've ever had. Bartender very chill too. Good, quiet place.
author: Ryan N.

description:
Great addition to the neighborhood.  Drinks are good but not great.  They have a very limited selection of spirits and seem understaffed.  It is going to take some improvements to get on the level of the Bourbon and Branch empire.  That being said, the space is nice and is a much needed addition to the neighborhood.  The placed was packed during happy hour on a Friday and seemed to empty out a bit after 8 pm.  I wonder if Giants fans will discover this place before or after games.  

Much better vibe than 25 Lusk the only other real bar in the neighborhood.
author: Moe J.

description: Went to the year anniversary Party and had a blast. This place has a great vibe, is near public transportation, and has amazing staff. If you're looking for great drinks and an awesome true San Francisco vibe, then make sure you visit Alchemist Bar & Lounge. Big Ups!!!!!
author: Sam F.

description: The Alchemist is a decent place, with a good cocktail menu and acceptable craft beer selection. Where they fall short is the service --- it was a quiet night, and we struggled to get the bartenders attention to serve a party of 6. They acted like we were inconveniencing them vs. providing the kind of high quality experience the place would suggest. With plenty of great bars in the city, that's reason enough to not go back.
author: Andy S.

description: Very loud, crowded, crazy atmosphere. Drinks are really good, easy to hang out with other ppl. Loved it, probably because I was super drunk, but it was wayyyyyy too loud. Could not hear what my friends were saying.
author: Heidi L.

description: The lounge at the second floor is a nice place that looks a bit gothic but the barmen don't know how to make good cocktails: too dry or too sweet with zero subtlety. My friend had a Mint Julep and the mint wasn't event crushed. Forget it.
author: Nina K.

description:
This new entry into the San Francisco cocktail scene fits neatly into the portfolio.  It has Steampunk/Edwardian decor, tasty drinks with cool names and unusual flavors, and you even have to go up a staircase to get in.

Overall, The Alchemist is quite solid, but still sanding off the corners of a new establishment:  It's a little overdesigned/Disneyfied, and the cocktails, too, lack some finesse.  I expect that this will be resolved in time.  Considering the space and location, I expect a lot of this bar's traffic will be as a venue for private tech parties.
author: Lauren J.

description: Cool trendy new spot. Used to work next door to this space and had no idea it was even there before they opened the bar. Dimly lit, NYC loft style feel with exposed brick, Motown songs playing in the background.. Had the cocktail, 'somethin with vodhak' and it's one of the best drinks I've had in a long time!
author: Laura W.

description:
i love this place!! 

awesome cocktails, cool ambiance, chill crowd, never overly crowded or sleazy. 

extra star for no hipster too cool mixoligist- bartenders!!

an overall great spot for good drinks. really pleased that i live around the corner from here :)
author: Shanna N.

description: Excellent drinks but virtually no seating. Most of the crowd cleared out by 9:30. We found 2 small stools, very uncomfortable. We left after one round of drinks. Too bad. Invest in comfortable seating guys, we would have been happy to stay and order many more drinks. A couple of reserve only sofas and a few crappy stools isn't enough.
author: Suzie H.

description: Looking for a spacious, hipster, trendy bar after the Giant's game? Look no further and come here! Many creative cocktails to meet your group's needs. I came with a large group after a Giant's game and we all left very happy after being fueled with great cocktails. They also serve food! Come by!
author: Jennifer D.

description: Amazing cocktails! Great atmosphere! You basically have two entrances, with different rooms. Worth trying if you enjoy good cocktails!
author: Looblue L.

description: 4 stars, really? You can barely hear any music and there's no Patron available for consumption. I wouldn't return.
author: Amanda M.

description: Very much of a San Francisco bar. Totally a must see when you come to San Francisco. The decor, atmosphere and drinks are a 10 out of 10.
author: Alex C.

description: I ordered a non-alcoholic drink last night and the bar tended charged me $11 for its-the same price as their alcoholic cocktails. That is not fair and its also not really encouraging designated drivers....
author: Simret N.

description: The space is cool, with an awesome old school leather chair decor, and a projection on the wall. Every time I go, it happens to be more on the dead side inside... but that can be a good thing if you are in search of a quieter type of night. Would recommend to check out for something a little different in soma
author: M M.

description: cucumber gimlet!
author: Danica V.

description: Nice place to hangout... The ambience is cool and the decor is really cool. Not enough lounge space available. Otherwise a great option..
author: Moazzam K.

description: Ofcourse I'm a fan! Bartenders are awesome! Cocktails are very good. The space is very cool and big. Can get a little too crowded fri & sat. Downstairs serves bar food which is convenient if you're starving.
author: Food L.

description: Aww.. why just 4 stars everyone?  Oh I know.. we don't need this place to turn into a wretched Starbucks!!!  Alchemist B&L is a chill location and you get some decent drinks outside the ordinary..for example.. order up an espresso, and you also get a nice small little shot glass of mineral water to clear your pallet.    THAT IS HOT in my book....
author: Tito Y.

description: Freakin' awesome place! Excellent drinks and a really cool vibe. We had a pretty crazy large group and the staff managed us well. One of my favorite bars in SF. Highly recommend it!
author: Steve M.

description:
My wife and I went here after going to a Giants game for the first time. (Relax, we just moved to the bay area a month ago :-) ) We actually walked in to the Woodbury, thinking it was the Alchemist! Oops. Well, that worked out well because the poutine at the Woodbury was great! Separate review.

The Alchemist was excellent. This being the 2nd bar we had ever visited in SF, the the first being the Woodbury, we felt like we picked a winner. Awesome atmosphere, great drinks, attentive bartenders, and sexy people.

Can't wait to bring some friends there! (After we make some :-) )
author: PJ C.

description: Spacious, laidback, cool, and the staff are the greatest. Music was kinda loud, but when you're playing Aretha Franklin and then The Knife, you have my approval. The bouncers were awesome and the tall bartender with the curly hair and accent made me the GREATEST DRINK of my life after I just pointed to two ingredients on the bar and asked for a special creation. We left after the crowd turned Marina, but I'd definitely come back.
author: Jenn H.

description: Cute place. Really cute decor from first floor up and I can see myself really enjoying this place a couple of cocktails in. I got the drink with strawberries and rhubarb. Very interesting but yummy. Want to come back and try out more!
author: Ruby C.

description: I went there because a friend recommend. It is located in area where there aren't almost any bars, so is kind of death at night. The place is kind of hidden. Once you go up the stairs you are going to find a cool bar with really great music and drinks. It is a good bar to go with friends to drink something while you catch up with each other.
author: Vanesa F.

description: Great place upstairs for drinks. Comfortable areas to hang out with couches and tables.  Their tater tots, fries, chicken wings, and sliders were perfect for the great drinks. Bartenders were pretty efficient on getting drinks out. The only problem was the room got too hot (strange for SF), but they need it get better fans/circulation through the place
author: Jon H.

description: Love the space and vibe!  Unique and delicious drinks made by some cool bartenders.  Another added bonus; no problem finding parking! Definitely revisiting!
author: Sheri H.

description: I've been coming to Alchemist since day one and they always offer a great time!  Shuffleboard, great drinks, German movies (I think), and a great staff.  Kinson is always amazing, the best bar manager in the city.  Other than just regular outings, I spent my last New Years here and it didn't disappoint.  I've lived in SF for 9 years now, and this is my local's recommendation if you're by the ballpark or SOMA.  Order the Monkey Gland - let's get it back on the menu!!!
author: Matt P.

description: Love love love their low-key chill setting w/ equally cool tunes playing every time I'm there.  One of the bartenders, Michael, is the coolest dude behind the counter and makes amazing cocktails without even trying!  Awesome vibe guaranteed, truly a neighborhood gem!!!
author: Stephanie C.

description: Ok, I officially believe in alchemy. Because what the bartenders here did was nothing short of magic: they took tequila - a liquor I only have gag-inducing memories of from college days - and turned it into a phenomenal cocktail that I relished to the very last drop. If you're a fan of the classic Vieux Carre, do yourself a favor; get the Room With a Vieux here at the Alchemist and be blown away. We also tried the Stop Fenneling Me, which was different but heavy on the anise flavor. They have really strong pours so you get your money's worth out of these $11 cocktails. The venue is very retro with just the right touch of vintage pretense, with old-timey couches, bar stools, and black and white movies projected on the exposed brick walls. HH specials include $5 bubbly, $2 off wine, $1 off beers...but you can bet that I'll be sticking with the cocktails, continuing to marvel at The Alchemist's ability to convert me back into a drinker of tequila.
author: Clarice W.

description: It doesn't look much at the entrance, but walk right in and you'll have two floors of bars. The sports and console gaming bar is on the first floor and the cocktail chat bar is above it. Cocktails were cocktail price, so don't expect cheap drinks. Didn't get to stay too long but I've tried at least 5 of the cocktails on the list and it was all pretty good, though if you're just sick of menu choices, get the bartender to make his own! He would be more than willing to help you out. Ohhhhh... If you're hungry while drinking, they've got snacks; wings etc.
author: Ann Hui Y.

description: CAUTION:  DO NOT USE YOUR CREDIT CARD/ATM HERE.  FRAUDULENT ACTIVITY ON CARD AFTER LEAVING TAB OPEN HERE.  I left my tab open and forgot to close it.  I  was unable to go get my card and had to wait until the following weekend.  I emailed, called, left messages and received no response.  I checked my card activity and there was no activity since my tab so I decided not to close it to avoid having to wait 10 days for my new card and 10$ fee to replace my card. I picked up the card, coincidently, that is when the fraudulent activity began.  The fact that I picked it up was an indication to the whomever that I wasn't going to cancel the card.  At this point, they quickly started making multiple small purchases on my account until my bank caught on and blocked it.  I am disputing the charges. MANAGEMENT NEEDS TO SELECT BETTER STAFF.  Also, the bartender was rude, made a mistake and made me a gin and soda (instead of vodka/soda) and told me it wasn't gin when I alerted him to the mistake.  He later admitted it was gin when I insisted it didn't taste right.  He also overcharged me, charged me 12$ for one vodka soda)
author: L G.

description:
chill place.  mixology focused
for example, a hit was Somethin' With Vokahh -- vodka, elderflower liqueur, lime, thyme syrup, ginger beer.
if you like local edition, novella, you'd probably like the menu here.
they serve tator tots!
author: Rob C.

description: First: not a bar person or a hipster.. that said I LOVED this place!  Could not get over how great the ambiance is and how good the drinks are.  Loved how it was decorated and theme so perfectly executed.   I had the Monkey Glad & Somethin' with Vodka.  They are both deliciously dangerous.  Not from SF so there was some sticker shock with the price of the cocktails.  We left at about midnight Saturday night and was really sanding room only.
author: Michelle S.

description: Probably one of my favorite bars in SF. They am awesome cocktails, and the decor of the place is fantastic. Very well executed.
author: Megan S.

description:
This place just opened in SOMA and I was so excited.  I called all my girl friends and set up a ladies night and reserved a lounge area for $150 for happy hour.  It seemed so convenient and easy to do online, but there was very little description on how things work, like would we get kicked out or our seats at 9pm if the seats were reserved after that, etc.  I emailed them for the answers and they didn't respond.  I finally just pulled the trigger and paid the $150 and then I got all my email responses.  Not great customer service off the bat...should have been a sign.

Once we got there we had a nice table in the corner with some fun chairs, but they were completely uncomfortable because it was so loud in there at happy hour we all had to yell and lean forward out of our chairs to talk.  I thought this place was made for large groups because of how they set up the reservations, but if you come with more than two people you won't hear anyone at the other end of the table.  We ended up playing musical chairs so we could talk to everyone.  

Two of my girl friends got there at 5pm, I got there at 5:30pm and at that time the server still hadn't come over to ask for an order yet.  We waited another 15 minutes and I gave up and went up to the bar to see if there was a server coming, since we hadn't actually seen one.  The bar tender wouldn't look at me and seemed annoyed I was cutting his line to ask a question.  He snapped at me to go back to my seat and said she would be there soon.  Soon was about another 20 minutes later.  

The server was very nice, and she apologized for being late, but that doesn't make up for the fact that we lost an hour and a half of our 4 hour time window that I already paid for!  We ordered lots of food and drinks, which took the normal amount of time.  The server did bring over a inexpensive bottle of Cava, which was pretty good, to say sorry, however the problem with that is the $150 minimum for the table was only on alcohol and now we are getting drunk on a something cheap and we weren't able to get to our minimum because who can drink $150 worth of alcohol between 5 girls in two hours!

No where on the reservation site did it say the minimum was only for alcohol, if it did is wasn't clear.  We ended up spending almost $300, because the waitress suggested buying two bottles of wine to cover the minimum and we could take it home.  I'm pretty sure that is bad drinking and driving practice and I see them loosing their liquor license over that one day.  The bottles went over the $150 minimum and then they added tax and gratuity on, which is how the bill got so high!  I would have liked to lower the gratuity.  It was only a party of 5!

Lastly, the bill actually came in two parts!  Apparently the food is a different company, so they need to bill separate.  This made it harder to calculate who owed what.  The food was great.  Way better than all the drinks.  

In the end, I will never ever be going back to this bar.  They treated us bad, took our money, and we left unsatisfied and tired.
author: Andrea C.

description: Went on a Thursday night and it was not too crowded but there was a good amount of people there. The leather couches were cool for hanging out. The GF had a glass of wine for $8 and I had Dales Pale Ale in a can for $5 . Decent prices for this area.  The movies on the wall are a little creepy which made for a good vibe in late October. Worth a stop by if you're looking for a drink in the area.
author: Paul K.

description: Alchemist is the spot you hit when you don't want the "run of the mill" cocktail. No party atmosphere, just good ole relaxing with a beverage & people watching. I have been in when it has been super busy as well as quiet as a church mouse. All my experiences there have been pleasant. Last summer they even allowed us to have my son's steam-punk inspired high school graduation party in their space. Being that most of the attendees were underage, the bar staff kindly made "mocktails" for his celebration & they were EXCELLENT. I was allowed to bring in a caterer & a DJ as long as the noise stayed at a decent level. Their help arranging everything was priceless & they get extra bay love for that night. I take visiting guests, old friends & business associates to their well hidden location. They are a  jewel of SF.
author: M G.

description: I love Alchemist it is a perfect spot to chill after work or to hang out on a Friday night. If your looking for an awesome original cocktail (fruit and Veggies to!), or a bite to eat with your beer GO check out Alchemist. Great for birthdays, and any other event in which you need to be supplied with tasty cocktails and music. Love the Staff always more than happy to leave a generous tip! They work for it. Go check it out for yourself,  See You There! ; )  ENJOY!
author: Angelique B.

description: Went to the city for the weekend it was my girlfriend birthday alchemist was a highlight of the trip she had a fabulous time great evening big group of friends loses of fun..
author: Michael H.

description: Don't like the menu as much as at Tradition, but it attracts the right crowd for a good night. Saw friends from three different circles on the same night! Must mean it's the next hot spot where the coolest people like to hang out. ;)
author: Jessica C.

description: Nice ambiance, spacious, nice cocktails. Recommended place!
author: Aditya S.

description: Definitely has that Local Edition vibe going for it but a little more casual. Drinks were very tasty but they can certainly have a bit more variety especially of the more fruity/girly type. The big open space and split levels makes the space very cool and a little different. I'd definitely come back and see how the place evolves and makes it's mark on SOMA.
author: Karen N.

description: I'm not a huge bar fan, but I am a fan of this bar! they have really great drink options for the non-drinker (me) and there are some really great servers. I really had a great experience each time I went.
author: J W.

description: The review is mainly for cocktails: Pretty nice cocktails true to its name. The decor us nice too. We were here for a huge party and still the bartenders were pretty fast. They kept the bar area clear to not let us block other customers. Definitely try the '4th regiment' and 'somethin with vokah'
author: S G.

description: I like this place a lot, however I'm deducting one and a half stars after witnessing a bartender doing 2 cash transactions for different customers, then without washing hands went on to make the next customer's cocktail which included mint leaves which were plucked with dirty fingers and put into the glass. Gross... just gross. I'll stick to bottled beer and wine here. I don't need the flu. I really watch for this and have noticed this at other bars too - they are definitely not the only offenders.
author: J L.

description: An excellent mixology lounge. Warm and inviting with excellent music played at just the right volume, comfy couches, superbly crafted and excellent tasting drinks. Plus, it's new so no one knows about it yet, keeping the crowds very low. Oh, and there's shuffle board. Yeah, that's right.
author: Jacobus B.

description:
The beer selection is terrible. 
One extra star for having shuffleboard. 
You're deep in SOMA, you're not that cool, get some more beer and get over yourselves.
author: Randy M.

description: Very nice bar on a quiet street in SOMA. Excellent craft cocktails, vintage leather couches, old timey decor throughout, and black and white films projected onto the exposed brick wall. Yeah, it's that kind of place, one that fits in with the continually gentrifying and richifying San Francisco nightlife scene, but it's pretty cool, large, and the cocktails were awesome. I went during happy hour, before dinner, so it wasn't crowded yet... but it seems like the type of place that can get packed on Friday and Saturday night.
author: Seth G.

description: Went there on the soft opening preview night and other than getting a little damp roaming the sidewalk trying to find the place, it was a gem!  Great signature cocktails that focus on quality liquor and hand made syrups.  The decor, vibe, and soundtrack are perfect for an old soul like me!  Will definitely be back soon, especially around baseball season!
author: Nick A.

description: Great happy hour inna beautiful brick loft!
author: Julie T.

description: Lovely spacious bar, attentive staff. Lost a star for not having the ingredients for white russians.
author: Eliza D.

description: I LOVE this place ! Always feel so welcome whenever I go there. I feel comfortable going alone or bringing a large group. The service is great and the atmosphere really chill. Never uptight there.  It's definitely a place to go to over and over again.
author: A L.

description: The next Local Edition?  Parking sux cuz every meter on the street needs to be paid til 10pm thanks to the ball park.
author: Fatty A.

description: This is our go to higher end cocktail bar in the hood.  The crowd is similar to our tastes.  I usually always get the something with Vodkahh.  It's nice and refreshing.  Like the shuffleboard table, gives people something to do while your waiting at the long line to get the drinks from the bar.
author: Sheetal P.

description: Been here a couple of times -- not too much character per se but it's a chill place. The Shrub Down and Somethin' Vodka are solid drinks, not a huge fan of the 14th Regiment. Food is on par with most bar food.
author: Rowena L.

description: Very new place in the Mission Bay.  I used to live around here, and wish this place was there when I was there.  It is a great addition to the area.  The decor is very dim, and they have a couple of old movies playing off the brick building wall.  It's a very relaxed atmosphere, and the servers are very friendly and attentive. Felt like my friends were running the place.  We had shots all night, and I did try one drink that has jalapenos in it.  Very nice to drink it a 1:00 am to give a kick in my head.  I didn't like the Dale's pale ale beer though, very bitter, but the good think was I was able to nurse that beer for about an hour.  I hope this place does well and attracts more girls!  Way too many guys the night we were there.
author: James W.

description: I went to this pace on NYE.  What a nice experience, it was what I needed to start off my night.  Not only did they have a nice photo booth, gotta do that every once in a while, but the drinks were superb at a reasonable price.  The one thing I did like is that it changed as the night progressed.  So 1/2 of the drinks were different than when I got there.  That was nice to try some other speak easy drinks.  A sure spot to visit!
author: M C.

description: A good friend of mine had his birthday here Saturday night. Very relaxed atmosphere with friendly staff. If you want to try something different, I would definitely recommend this place. It just looks like somebody spent a lot of time going for the speakeasy feel, from the exposed brick and plumbing, down to the chairs and light bulbs. The drinks menu looked interesting, but I really only tried the "Something with Vokkah" (No, I didn't misspell it, and I'm still not sure what that something really was.) Overall, nice addition to SoMa.
author: Alex S.

description: A friend found this place last minute for a birthday gathering, via Yelp. Such a fantastic find.  First off the doorman checking ID's was chill, gave off good vibes before even walking in the door. He was even nice to talk with when stepping outside a few different times. Was a nice laid back atmosphere. With areas on the main floor and an upper area to sit and lounge while sipping some amazing hand crafted drinks. The bartenders were great. Even tried a few of there new concoctions. The appetizer menu was small. But everything on there is well worth ordering two of each.
author: Bryan I.

description: Fabulous cocktail list - service is great! The ambiance is fun and they have great music playing all the time.  I've always had  amazing experience here and I will continue to come back for years to come!
author: Brittany M.

description: Monkey Gland was good. Good vibe and enjoyed playing with the mini shuffle board table.
author: Xteethx B.

description: Very chill lounge space with an excellent selection of specialty cocktails. It's like soma's version of local edition.
author: Ali H.

description:
Cool bar... Not too busy, crowd was aiete and the drinks were good.  Just a bit on the expensive side.  I liked how we could move the sofas and tables around however we wanted and nobody had a problem with it.  The guys working the front were cool too.  

I'll be back if I'm in the area again.
author: JungHyun H.

description: It's a bar. It's a pretty good bar. There is really nothing too special about the specialty drinks but they are not bad. I really wish that they had some beers on tap instead of just in bottles. If you are in the area or looking for a place to hit up before a Giant's game this is a good option and better than the bars right next to the ballpark. It's large and the wait for drinks isn't too bad.
author: Frank J.

description: Great place to grab a cocktail. The drinks are very well made. The ambiance is nice and unique and they have shuffleboard!
author: Matt J.

description: I'm not usually into bars, but Alchemist has such a cool decor and great drink selection, I'll definitely be back.
author: Richard F.

description: Underwhelmed. Awful service. Two or three bartenders working with a medium sized crowd. Waited for twenty minutes and gave up. Don't waste your time.
author: Elaine K.

description: I went to The Alchemist for the first time this evening with some friends from work. I have definitely found a new after work spot! The drinks were delicious. The atmosphere was very warm and inviting. Will definitely go there again and again.
author: Allison M.

description: This is a super cool bar. Loved the decor, had this nice steam-punk / speakeasy feel to it. The happy hour lasts till 8pm, which is sweet. I kinda like that the crowd there is a bit classier, older (30's & 40's) vs the giggly , loud 20-something crowds that get tiresome at 83 Proof & Rickhouse. I'll be back.
author: Jen S.

description: Cool place in SOMA.  I like the drink prices a lot more than the other speakeasy type bars in SF (B&B, Local Edition, etc.).  Only wish they had more beers on tap but I guess that's going against the whole speakeasy vibe they have going...
author: Alyse S.

description: My new favorite local bar. Perfect volume for the music which allows you to still be able to have a conversation. The decor and atmosphere are cool, and part of the space feels like you're hanging out in a huge living room. Love it!
author: Karen S.

description: Happy to see a new bar open up in my neighborhood. The Alchemist reminds me of Local Edition - both place an emphasis on high-end drinks and the decor is a throwback to earlier times. Came here last Saturday around 1am (ok, technically early Sun morning) and it wasn't packed but had a decent crowd of people. I don't remember the name of my drink but it had St. Germain in it and was pretty tasty. Will definitely be back for happy hour since I work down the street.
author: Susan C.

description: This is one of my favorite places to go in the city.  I love the vibe, the cocktails are amazing, and the staff is awesome.  I especially love their smoking hot cocktail waitress Taylor.  She always gives the best service.  If I was a dude I would have for sure already asked for her number
author: Nicole M.

description: Been here on a Saturday night around 11, and well we had to wait to get in, even though it was not full house. Once inside we stayed approximately 10 min, noise is terrible, no music just that super extra loud noise of the crowd talking. I'd give another shot another day but so far not a good impression.
author: Renaud P.

description: I like nice bars.  I'm really into the couches and the upscale vibe, but even with all the amenities, I did not really like this bar.  The severity and seriousness of the staff was bordering on uncomfortable and, combined with the craft cocktail vibe, seemed overly pretentious.  It was quiet and near empty on a Saturday night.  I had 2 cocktails and they were very weak.  I'm a total lightweight and wasn't at all buzzed.  My cocktails tasted okay, but my boyfriend ordered something that was undrinkable (as in, he literally took 1 sip and decided to go buy something else).  I would not go back.
author: Kelly M.

description: What else to do on a Monday night?  Cuddle up on one of the couches and enjoy sipping an overpriced, although delightful, cocktail.  Spacious and comfortable, a bit loud. For some reason, I was reminded of 'Edward Scissorhands' by the darkness and the projected videos, but all the same...worth a try.
author: Liz C.

description: Bartender was rude...end of story! Not worth being in a place like this. The service was beyond bad. It's absolutely the worst bar, I have ever been too. I would give it no stars if I could.
author: Diana M.

description: atmosphere is wonderful, it feels warm and cozy, but not so exclusive that you feel out of place.  the upper level is just a perfect place for a private party, far enough from the crowd that you get some privacy, but still close enough to where the action is, the bar.  bartenders are all very friendly, they smile like waiters/waitresses do, unlike other bars.  when you talk to them they respond because they care.  lastly, you can really tell the bartenders want to be there, that they enjoy their work, and not a means to an end.  the drinks are hardcore, they don't water down anything.  they carry as much of a punch as they are tasty, and most importantly, creative.  lastly, they have a friendly "bouncer" who checks IDs at the door downstairs.....that's unheard of!!!
author: Wailun Eugene W.

description: Great drinks, young asian crowd, feels like a dive bar, very far from a lounge, miscategorised bridge n tunnel bar
author: Gg M.

description: great place with great service.  love the red brick interior.
author: Terence F.

description: Such a nice place. Their "beez nuts " is really good. Nice service, nice atmosphere, nice drinks
author: Rstay A.

description: the atmosphere was upbeat yet not too laud to converse, pretty comfy cozy with an "interesting" decoration, they have refined cocktails (at least two that i tried) SUPER tasty!
author: Giselle C.

description: Eh, so I don't know why my experiences have been so wack at this place, but let me tell you about it.  The first time I went, my bartender was high or something.  He started making my friend's drink and took a good 10 minutes to pour whiskey into the cup, and had started on mine, got distracted, walked to the back of the bar and I think kind of had a storytelling session with another bartender, came back, finished making my drink and just kind of sat the drink in front of him and didn't hand it to me.  We had to reach around people to grab our drinks and he started on some others.  We stared at him to see if he wanted payment, and he didn't pay attention or care.  So we put cash down (ugh, too nice) and walked away, puzzled. I thought maybe this would be a first time thing, but i went back another night and the service wasn't as strange or crappy but still really slow.  Unfortunately, this place extremely close to my house and may become a go-to bar for me, so we'll see how this progresses!  *FACEPALM*
author: Terry K.

description: Cool little spot with quite impressive tasty drinks.  friendly bouncer.  Definitely a quite spot to hang with friends and grab a few drinks before a long night.  Quick and attentive bartenders.  Only real downside the lack of seating.
author: Stan L.

description: Busy on a Wednesday. Drink prices are a little high and not worth it, but I guess that's so they keep out the riff raff. Full bar. Yuppie privileged atmosphere. I wouldn't come back unless someone was buying my drinks.
author: D W.

description: good ambiance, bartenders and staff were helpful and nice. i attended an event for happy hour and the food was good, everything ran smoothly, and everyone was having a good time. i've always been a fan of the black and white movies projected on the wall: it's always a good distraction when things are getting slow/awkward.
author: Myles J.

description: Went before it officially opened but the place was packed nonetheless. Great mixology drinks. Reminded me of Local Edition.
author: Andy K.

description: Nice, big open space.  Music was not blasting, so you can actually have a conversation.  Decent SOMA crowd for a Saturday night.  However, drinks were inconsistent and bartenders were taking their sweet time even though the place was pretty empty.  The old fashioneds were made poorly and not served in a lowball/rocks glass.  Overall, meh experience here.
author: David M.

description: Update: One of the managers did email me back and apologize.  I'll bump it up a star and maybe go back one day to check it out.  Hopefully they've ironed out the kinks by now.
author: Raj S.
